loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI (5 mariées et 2 veuves) ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35  ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles de fêtes, de pagnes et de chaussures avec KADIATOU T.. 
KADIATOU T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 62 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO et à Bamako. Les chaussures sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE, de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the SINIGNESSIGUI solidarity group (five married women and two widows) average 35 years of age and four children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their first time collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their income generating activities. These women sell party supplies, pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and shoes.

With this loan, Kadiatou T. plans to buy 62 pairs of shoes. She gets her stocks at the big market of Sikasso and also in Bamako. The shoes are then sold at the Medine market of Hamdallaye, in Sikasso, and within the family, for cash, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used for the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Django

texts.es:
El señor Django es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres durante mucho tiempo, en la zona de Rincón La Portada de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente es medico odontólogo que acaba de salir de la universidad, cuenta con un ambiente en su casa, el cual utiliza como clínica dental realizando curaciones y armado de placas dentales en la misma zona de La Paz. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de equipos de odontología para su clínica y brindar mejor servicio a su clientela así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Django is single and doesn't have any children.  He has lived in his parents' home for a long time, in Rincón La Portada district of the city of La Paz.

Django is a medical dentist who has just finished university.  He has an area in his home that he uses as a dental clinic, treating patients and making dentures.  This is how he makes income for his household.

Django will use his loan to buy dentistry equipment for his clinic so that he can provide his clients with a better service and thereby improve his income.  This is his first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his dental clinic

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El Señor Modesto Batállanos N. es casado y es padre de familia de 2 hijos a los cuales apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su esposa, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, el cliente y su esposa tienen una tienda de barrio, ademas el cliente se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino para ser comercializado en los diferentes mercados de Cochabamba y el trópico, también trabaja como trasportista en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 2 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con  una parada y turnos para cada afiliado, donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio
.
Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería para una tienda de barrio en la cual su esposa trabajara y le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Modesto Batállanos N. is married and has two children. He and his wife are responsible for their support and education. She is a hardworking dependable woman. 

Modesto and his wife run a neighbourhood shop. Modesto also raises pigs to sell in the various Cochabamba and Trópico markets and works in transportation in the Ivirgarzama area. He’s been an active member of the transportation company for more than two years. It’s a profitable job; many people ask for him because he provides straightforward, quick, and efficient service. For each member, the union organizes shifts and a stop so that customers know where to go to get service. 

This is the first time that Modesto has asked for a loan from our institution. He plans to use the money to buy merchandise for his shop where his wife works, and thus increase income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BADEYA  (3 célibataires et 1 mariée) ont une moyenne d’âge de 26  ans et en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à FAMA, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les six prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonnes conditions. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les tissus avec  ASTAN B.. 
ASTAN B.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 35 pagnes wax.Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO et à Bamako .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de MEDINE,  de HAMDALLAYE à SIKASSO et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BADEYA group (three are single and one is married) are on average 26 years old and have one child.  They live in monogamous families in Fama, a district of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their goal is to satisfy the demand of their clients.  All of the six previous loans have been properly repaid. This group of women is in the business of selling various articles such as fabric with Astan B.. 

Astan B. plans to buy 35 Wax pagnes (brightly colored fabric used for clothing).  She gets her supplies at the main market in Sikasso and in Bamako.  

The Wax pagnes are resold at retail at the market in Medine, in Hamdallaye, in Sikasso and within the family to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to cover daily family expenses.  Her goal is to increase her turnover in order to better meet the demand of her clients.

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 39 years old. She lives with her family in the area named Chorasta which is located in a city Depalpur. Depalpur is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She has been living there since her marriage. 
She is a housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities.  
Her husband’s name is A. G. and he operates a construction supplies business in the market. He is doing this business for over 15 years and has a good clientele base. 
Rani has given birth to 2 daughters both are illiterate and couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in bulk which enable him to fulfill the demands of his customers and earn maximum profits. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia  al lado de su esposo y sus dos  hijos; juntos luchan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 7 años, esta emprendedora mujer comercializa ropa y calzado que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amistades. La mercadería la brinda al crédito  y de acuerdo al plazo que ha convenido con sus clientes, regresa para cobrarles, es por esta razón que siempre  tiene un control detallado de sus ventas para  evitar perdidas. Por el buen manejo del dinero de su negocio ha logrado  establecerse con cantidad de clientes que le realizan regulares compras con frecuencia, y en el futuro tiene planeado dedicarse a esta actividad con miras a establecer un lugar fijo de ventas.Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y esta muy comprometida en  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los  integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el dinero que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Lourdes tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  mercadería  y espera aprovechar esta época de intensas lluvias que existen por su zona y comercializar cantidad de  casacas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and two children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.

For the past 7 years, this enterprising woman has been selling clothes and shoes which she offers from door to door, to her neighbors and friends.  She provides her merchandise on credit and, in accordance with the repayment terms that she has agreed with her customers, she returns to collect payment later.  This is why she always has detailed control of her sales, so that she doesn't make any losses.  Through her good management of her business money, she has managed to set herself up with a number of customers who make regular purchases from her.  In the future, she plans to carry out this business activity with a view to setting up a permanent sales location.

This is Lourdes' ninth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She likes being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive of each other.  She would also like to thank the people who will make this loan possible as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.

Lourdes plans to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of merchandise and she hopes to take advantage of the rainy season in her area to sell a large number of jackets.

loans.use: To buy jackets to stock her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth C. M. es una joven que se dedica a la producción de pan  en la casa de su madre desde hace 3 años no tiene hijos es soltera vive en la urbanización Leónidas que se encuentra al sud este de la zona del plan 3000 que esta 45 minutos de la ciudad 

Ella quiere mejorar su producción para lo que necesita de mayor cantidad de insumos y así poder mejorar su producción con esta ayuda ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que con este trabajo también ayuda a su madre con en el sustento diario de la familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth C. M. is a young woman who has been making bread in her mother’s house for three years.  She is single and has no children.  She lives in the Leónidas neighborhood, which is southeast of the Plan 3000 zone.  It is 45 minutes from the city.

She wants to improve her production.  Therefore, she needs a greater quantity of supplies.  That way she will be able to improve her production.  With this help she will be able to improve her quality of life.  With this work she also helps her mother with the daily support of the family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to increase her bakery business

loans.name: Muqqadas' Group

texts.en:
Muqqadas belongs to Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in the area named Chorasta for past 8 years. 
She is a housewife and stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 
She is only 20 years old and married in very early age. Her husband’s name is M. K. and he operates an electric shop in the market. Through the shop, he not only sells electric supplies like bulbs, tube-lights, wires but also offers electricity repairing services to his customers. He is operating this business for past 5 years. 
Muqqadas is very supportive lady in nature. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan to buy electric supplies for his electric shop.  
Muqqadas is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to more profitable position and she will be able to send her elder son to school that is 4 years old and is in school going age. Her younger son is  just one year old. 
She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies for electic shop

loans.name: Kobekoun Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOBEKOUN sont mariés, ont en moyenne 43  ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de commune rurale  de NIENA, Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mener les activités de commerce. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe, de condiments, de tissus et des poissons et de la pâte d’arachide à l’image de   S. T.. 
S. T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 kg de poissons fumés et 5 sacs d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et dans  les villages environnants auprès des producteurs.
Le poisson et la pâte d’arachide sont revendus au  marché de NOUGOUME et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000FCFA  qu’elle compte utiliser  pour contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of the KOBEKOUN group are married, are on average 43 years old and have 5 children.  They live mostly in polygamous families in NOUGOUME, a village in the rural commune of Niena, Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their first joint loan with the microfinance institution SoroYiriwaso.  Their goal is to be able to manage a business. These women are in the business of selling firewood, condiments, fabric, fish and peanut butter, as does S. T.. 

S. T. plans to buy 30 kg of smoked fish and five sacks of peanuts with her loan.   She gets her supplies at the main market in Niena and from producers in neighboring villages. 

The fish and the peanut butter are resold at the market in Nougoume and within the family to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash at retail.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to help cover daily family expenses.  Her ambition is to increase her turnover in order to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and peanuts

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio, de  53 años, vive solo con su esposa  en su casa  que es propia.Desde hace más de 20 años este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la fabricación de corbatas, y su esposa lo apoya en esta actividad ya que se ha constituido en un negocio familiar. Una vez que  terminan su labor reparten su mercadería  a las distintas tiendas de ropa con las que tienen contrato y también venden  de manera directa. Le  agrada trabajar fabricando corbatas porque su confección es sencilla y no requiere de maquinaria sofisticada para elaborarlas; además le resulta muy rentable pues por su zona es un tipo de prenda muy demandado, y asegura una producción estable. Su deseo a futuro es instalar  un taller más grande porque el que tiene en su casa necesita de mayor implementación y  para mas adelante desea mejorar sus instrumentos de trabajo.Es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente  respaldado de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, además agradece  a todas las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo ya que le  será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Lucio tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de insumos (diversidad de telas) que necesita  para seguir fabricando corbatas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Lucio, age 53, lives alone with his wife in their own house.  For over 20 years this enterprising man has been making ties.  His wife helps him with this activity because it has been set up as a family business.

Once they finish the work, they distribute their merchandise to the different clothing stores that they have contracts with.  They also sell directly.  It pleases him to work making ties because making them is easy, and it does not require sophisticated machines to make them.  Also, it is very profitable for him.  This type of clothing is in much demand in his zone and assures stable production.

His wish for the future is to set up a larger shop.  The one that he has in his house needs to be better stocked.  Later, he wants to improve his work instruments.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He feels supported knowing that he has financial help.  He has always shown himself to be responsible with his payments.  It pleases him to be part of his communal bank because all of the people are responsible and very supportive.  He also thanks all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan.  The loan will be very useful to him in the progress of the business.

Lucio plans to use the requested loan to buy supplies (a diversity of fabrics) that he needs to keep making ties.  This way he hopes to improve his earnings.

loans.use: To buy a diversity of fabrics for his business

loans.name: Nietaga Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe NIETAGA (6 mariés  et 2 veuves), avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants, vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de la commune rurale de NIENA préfecture   de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels  le beurre de karité avec MASSEBE S.. 
MASSEBE S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 60 Kg de beurre de karité. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et villages voisins auprès des productrices. Le beurre de karité est vendu à NIENA et en famille à une clientèle composée de revendeurs, surtout au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA  qu’elle envisage utiliser  pour rembourser le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the NIETAGA group (six are married and two are widowed) are on average 44 years old, have three children, and live mostly in monogamous families in Nougoume, a village in the rural community of Niena, in the Sikasso prefecture (third administrative region of Mali).  
They are on their first joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  Their goal is to meet the demands of their clients.   This group of women is involved in the business of selling various products such as shea butter with Massebe S.. 
Massebe S. plans to buy 60 Kg of shea butter with her loan.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Niena and from producers in neighboring villages.  The shea butter is sold in Niena and within the family to a clientele of vendors, generally for cash. 
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA which she plans to use to repay the loan and to contribute to daily family expenses. 
Her goal is to increase her turnover to better meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy shea butter

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
YEREDEME est un regroupement de six femmes, toutes mariées, ayant  en moyenne 40  ans, 3 enfants et vivant majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à NOUGOUME, un des villages de la commune rurale  de NIENA région de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait la cueillette, le commerce de Sounbala et de beure de karité avec ROKIA K., qui   compte acheter avec son  prêt,  35 Kg de beure de karité.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA et  dans les villages environnants. Le beure de karité est revendu au  marché de NIENA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA  qui sera utiliser  pour contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Yeredeme is a group of six women, all married, averaging 40 years old and 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Nougoume, a village in the rural commune of Niena, Sikasso region (3rd administrative district of Mali).

This is the first time they have worked with micro-finance institution  Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. The women harvest fruits and sell "sounbala" (a condiment used in cooking) and shea butter. Group member Rokia K. plans to buy 35 kg of shea butter with her loan. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Niena and the surrounding villages. Shea butter is re-sold at the Niena market and to family members, for cash or on credit, to customers who are both men and women. Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet the family's everyday needs.

loans.use: To buy shea butter

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is 33 years old housewife who prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities.  
Her husband operates an electric supplies shop in the market from where he sells electric supplies like bulbs, tube-lights and electric wires etc and also offers electricity repairing services to his customers. For this purpose he has hired an electrician on monthly wage. He is the only breadwinner in the family. 
Abida is the mother of 3 daughters and 2 sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school except the last two who are not of school going age yet. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electric supplies in bulk and increase his sales. This will give him edge over his competitors and help him making more income. 
He is doing this business for over 10 years and Abida is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to increase his income by expanding his business. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and always paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy elecric supplies for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, sausages

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hijo; y juntos de esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 6 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de mercería y ropa interior. Brinda su mercadería de manera ambulante durante todos los días incluidos los fines de semana, y como realiza sus ventas en el exterior, generalmente  usa  su sombrilla que la protege del sol y de las lluvias. Tiene regular cantidad de clientes pues sus productos los ofrece a precio bajos que son de la preferencia de sus compradores, además se abastece de mercadería en las tiendas distribuidoras de su ciudad y considera que su trabajo es una labor  rentable y ventajosa para su economía pues tiene considerables ganancias. Para el futuro desea seguir en el negocio de comercio de mercería y ropa interior, además espera aumentar la cantidad de mercadería.Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y promete ser  responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias; además agradece  a las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Mery tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de  más mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
49-year old Mery lives in her own house with her son. Together they work hard on a daily basis to make progress in life. For the last six years this enterprising woman has sold notions and underwear in the local streets. She works every day including weekends. As she works outdoors, she generally sits under an umbrella to shelter her from the sun and rain.

Mery has regular customers who seek her out because she sells her products for low prices. She gets her stock from local distributors. Mery says her business is profitable and is doing well so she gets a good income from it.

In the future she wants to continue in the same business but expand her stock. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time. She is grateful for the opportunity to be part of her community bank as all the members are responsible and committed. She wishes to thank the donors as this loan will help her with her business. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, D.  44 años, vive en su casa que es propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.DesD. hace 10 años, atienD.  su granja D. animales donD. cría cuyes y gallinas, D. buena raza. Comercializa sus animales D. acuerdo a lo que sus clientes le solicitan,  generalmente los coloca en los mercados y también los comercializa para abastecer los banquetes D. su barrio, además  sus hijos L. apoyan a transportar sus animales cuando están disponibles. El desarrollo del negocio le ha permitido mejorar L. economía D. su hogar y se ha dado cuenta que es tranquilo y rentable, además tiene planeado aumentar L. cantidad D. animales que comercializa para mejorar sus rentas.Es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta D. contar con este apoyo financiero que le permitirá continuar trabajando; además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esta muy agradecida con las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, pues tiene el capital para seguir adelante.Reyna tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. animales D. raza que necesita para mejorar su producción en el negocio; además adquirirá algunos materiales D. construcción que necesita para mejorar su granja.
texts.en:
Reyna is 44 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.

For 10 years, Reyna has been working on her farm where she raises good breeds of guinea pigs and chickens.  She sells her animals in accordance with her customers' requests.  She generally sells them in markets and also to people who are hosting celebrations in her neighborhood.  Her children support her in transporting the animals when they are available.

The development of Reyna's business has allowed her to improve her household finances and she has come to realize that her business is both peaceful and profitable.  She is planning to increase the quantity of animals that she sells in order to improve her income.

This is Reyna's 13th loan with MFP and she is very happy to have this financial support which allows her to continue working.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is very grateful to the people who will make this loan possible since it will give her the capital she needs to get ahead.  Reyna plans to invest her money in buying the good breeds of animals she needs to improve her production.  She will also buy some building supplies that she needs to improve her farm.

loans.use: To buy animals for her business

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre mayor de 61 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos, su trabajo es como docente en el área de educación física y natación, el cual ha venido laborando por cuarenta años, educación física y natación.
Anteriormente trabajo de albañil, luego consigue la plaza en el colegio. A través de sus ahorros ha venido mejorando su vivienda junto con su esposa que es maestra también.
Pero necesita reparar parte del techo, aguas negras y pluviales, lo que no cuenta con mucho efectivo, lo que recurre al préstamo para hacer la obra. El por su propia cuenta no tiene  los recursos para ahorrar el dinero y echar a andar el proyecto por tal raozn fue que solicito a los Fondos Kiva la posibilidad para realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 61 years old, married and has two children.  He works as a physical education and swimming teacher.  He has been teaching physical education and swimming for forty years.  Carlos used to work as a construction worker before he gained his teaching post. 

Through his savings, Carlos has managed to improve his home together with his wife, who is also a teacher.  However, he needs to repair part of his roof, to sort out waste water and rainwater.  He does not have a lot of cash and so is taking a loan in order to do the job.  His loan from Kiva will make his objective possible.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal roofing, pipes, adhesive and other materials to deal with waste water and rainwater

loans.name: Rufo

texts.es: Rufo, de 39 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos en una casa arrendada; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante.Desde hace 4 años, este emprendedor hombre trabaja ofreciendo servicio de transporte con su auto, que es su esencial herramienta de trabajo. Sale todos los días a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de ocasionales clientes que solicitan el servicio de transporte a distintos puntos de su ciudad, además obtiene regulares ganancias pues cobra su servicio de acuerdo a la distancia. Considera que su trabajo es rentable porque el servicio que ofrece es muy solicitado en su ciudad, además siempre trata en lo posible de recorrer zonas urbanas que significa en su negocio prolongar el buen funcionamiento de su movilidad y de esta manera retrasa el desgaste. Para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar y comprar  un carro más para brindarlo en alquiler.Es el  14avo crédito que tiene  con MFP, y  se siente seguro de contar con este apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esta muy agradecido con todas las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Rufo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de repuestos y el pago de mantenimiento mecánico de su carro, y de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rufo is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in a rental house.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead.

For four years, this enterprising man has worked offering transport services in his car which is his essential work tool.  He goes out every day, driving through the city streets in search of occasional customers who require his transport service to get to different parts of the city.  He makes regular profits as he charges for his service according to distance travelled.  Rufo considers his work to be profitable because the service he offers is very much in demand in his city.  He also always tries, whenever possible, to provide his services in urban areas because, in his business, this is a good way to keep his vehicle in good working order and delays wear and tear on the vehicle.  In the future, he plans to improve and buy a further car that he can rent out.

This is Rufo's 14th loan with MFP and he feels secure with this financial support behind him.  He has always shown himself to be responsible with his loan repayments and he likes being a member of his community bank because the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  He is very grateful to the people who will help fund his loan as it will be very useful to him in making progress in his business.

Rufo plans to invest his loan money in buying spare parts and paying for his car to be serviced.  In this way, he hopes to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for his car to be serviced

loans.name: El Rinconcito (Comercio) Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama el "El RINCONCITO" (COMERCIO), es de la comunidad de Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso, resalto que en está comunidad se diferencia de otras porqué hay mucho profesionista, la mayoria son Licenciados y Maestros, y hay mucha gente preparandose en una carrera y estudiantes en general.

El grupo es de 4 integrantes es un grupo pequeño, antes habia mas gente en el grupo pero desidieron descansar un tiempo para despues seguir con el grupo, los integrantes son todos vecinos y se conocen desde hace años, comentan que el grupo se llama EL RINCONCITO porqué así se le conoce el lugar donde viven los vecinos, es porqué se encuentran en un rincon de la comunidad, de los 4 integrantes 2 son mujeres y 2 son hombres. Los nombres son los siguientes:

1.-Raymunda M. M., la señora es comerciante, tiene 55 años de edad.

2.-Ebelia C. Gómez, 50 años de edad

3.-German R. R., 49 años de edad

4.-Margarito Gónzalez T., 45 años de edad.

Los 4 integrantes son comerciantes, se dedican a la jarceria, todo lo referente al plastico, usan puestos ambulantes para cargar la mercancía y salen a vender los dias de plaza en cualquier parte.

La señora Raymunda M. es tesorera del grupo, tiene 55 años de edad, su negocio es un puesto ambulante de algunas vandejas, cremas, rastrillos, zacate de baño etc, los viernes y los domingos, entre semana atiende una tienda general de abarrotes, para lo que solicito su prestamo es para llenar de nuevo la tienda de mercancía, y de está manera saca dinero de ambos lados, se apoya de sus dos negocios.
Uno de los desafios de doña Raymunda son las ventas, no son lo que espera, hay dias muy bajos y la desespera demasiado, lo poco que se gana es para volver a invertir y seguir trabajando
La familia de doña Raymunda es algo grande, fueron 6 hijos los que tubo, 5 mujeres y 1 hombre, un hijo ya es casado, los otros trabajan, pero solo un hijo depende de ella, se encuentra estudiando y quiere terminar los estudios, por eso doña Raymunda lo sigue apoyando y parte de las ganancias son para sus pasejes a la escuela y para lo que le pidan.
Una de las metas es que su negocio le pueda seguir dando aunque sea poquito para que su hijo termine la escuela y no se quede a medias, doña Raymunda lleva 40 años de casada, vive con su esposo, es casa propia y su esposo solo se dedica al campo y ayudarla en la tienda cuando ella no esta.
texts.en:
This group is called "EL RINCONCITO" (The Little Corner).  It is located in the community of Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso.  This community is noted as being different from others because a lot of its residents are professionals.  Most people have university degrees and are teachers.  There are a lot of university students and students in general.

This group has 4 members.  It is a small group.  There used to be more people in the group but they decided to take a break for a while and then continue with the group later.  The members are all neighbors who have known each other for years.  They say that the group is called EL RINCONCITO (The Little Corner) because that is what the area they live in is known as because they live in a corner of their community.  Of the group's 4 members, 2 are women and 2 are men.  Their names are as follows:

1.-Raymunda M. M..  Raymunda is 55 years old and a saleswoman.

2.-Ebelia C. Gómez, 50 years old.

3.-German R. R., 49 years old.

4.-Margarito Gónzalez T., 45 years old.

The four members of this group are salespeople.  They sell cleaning supplies and plastic products.  They use carts which they load with merchandise and then go out to sell in different places on market days.

Raymunda M. is the group's treasurer.  She is 55 years old and she works as an itinerant street vendor, selling trays, creams, razors, bath sponges, etc.  She makes her sales on Fridays and Sundays.  During the week she serves in her grocery store.  She is requesting her loan to restock her store with merchandise and, in this way, make money from both businesses.

One of Raymunda's challenges is her sales.  They are not as good as she would hope for.  There are some days when she sells very little and she becomes exasperated.  However, she reinvests the little that she earns in her business and continues working.

Raymunda's family is quite large.  She has six children: five daughters and one son.  One of her children is married.  The others work.  Only one of her children is still dependent as he is studying and would like to finish his studies.  For this reason, Raymunda continues supporting him and part of her profits go towards paying for his journeys to school and whatever else he needs.

One of Raymunda's goals is to keep her business going, even though it isn't much, so that her son can finish school and not have to leave his studies half finished.  Raymunda has been married for 40 years.  She lives with her husband in her own home and her husband works in the fields and helps her with the store when she isn't there.

loans.use: To pay suppliers of soft drinks, chips, cookies and candy

loans.name: Solidario Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es:
CLEDIBERTA G. C.:
tiene 47 años ella tiene 3 hijas casadas, y un hijo que aun vive con ella, su negocio es venta D. ropa tipica, ella ya trabajo un credito compro una carreta para vender papas fritas y ahora cuenta con otros ingresos porque venD. refacciones y papas fritas en la tarD. frente a su casa y el credito D. ahora lo necesita para compra D. ropa tipica porque en esta epoca es vendible, su sueño mejoras su casa y poder ahorrar para que su negocio sea mas surtido con variedad D. ropa para todas las edades.
SOFIA B. G.:vive con su hijo tiene 52 años ella venD. ropa tipica, como blusas cortes, delantales ella solicita otro credito para invertirlo en compra D. ropa tipica, asi obtendra mas ganancias para mejorar su calidad D. vida y tambien para mejorar su casa donD. vive.
ANA DILIA T. G.:D. 23 años D. edad tiene un hijo pequeño venD. ropa tipica su negocio es ambulante ofrece su producto a las personas con trabajo; pero tiene buena demanda en la venta D. blusas y cortes ella solicita otro credito para compra D. ropa tipica,y asi incrementar sus ganacias, con el primer credito solo compro blusas ahora ya tiene cortes tipicos su sueño es darle lo necesario a su hijo y tener dinero para que pueda estudiar y sea profesional y D. apoyo a su esposo.
texts.en:
Clediberta G. C. is 47 years old.  She has three married daughters and one son who still lives with her.  Her business is selling traditional clothing.  She has already received one loan which she used to buy a cart for selling French fries.  She now has more income because she sells snacks and French fries in the afternoon opposite her home.  She needs this loan to buy traditional clothing which sells well at this time of year.  Her dream is to improve her home and to be able to save so that she can better stock her business with a range of clothes for all ages.

Sofia B. G. lives with her son.  She is 52 years old and sells traditional clothing such as blouses, skirts and aprons.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying traditional clothes.  In this way, she will make more profits and be able to improve her quality of life and her home.

Ana Dilia T. G. is 23 years old.  She has a young son and sells traditional clothing.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, selling to working people.  She has good demand for her blouses and skirts.  She is requesting this loan to buy traditional clothing and thereby increase her profits.  She used her previous loan to buy blouses.  Her dream is to proviD. her son with everything he needs and to have money so that he can study and become a professional and also so that she can support her husband.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase supplies for her daycare.

loans.name: Rok

texts.en:
Rok is a 53-year-old mother of eight who opened her business in 2007. She began by selling clothes from her home. In 2009, she set up a separate area in her home to display and sell. Over time, she has gained wise business experience, knows which suppliers to trust and what fashions are most popular with her current and potential customers. Now Rok is ready to open a store outside of her home in the open market – souk. The Souk store will widen her clientele and increase her monthly income.

Rok needs this loan to pay for the initial rental of the store location and additional stock.

Rok has seen a gradual but steady development to her business and she continues to apply lessons she learns from our training. Her dream is to open an additional branch in the city center and continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: To pay for the initial rent and additional stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock and prepare for the winter months

loans.name: Terese

texts.en:
Terese owns a flower shop in northern Israe,l which also caters to special events and celebrations. She is the mother of four grown children with a business with huge potential. Terese is the backbone of her family and her flower and specialty shop makes it possible for her to earn a living with respect. Terese studied and worked in events planning and tourism and then worked within the educational system for years teaching music. In the mid 1990's, Terese opened her flower shop. At the same time, her husband was advancing as a tractor trailer driver. Unfortunately, hard times hit and the family suffered from an investment scam, which took them years to recover. Terese has kept the shop going and in recent years, she and her husband are seeing the light at the end of the tunnel.

Terese needs this loan to open a satellite location that is needed for special events. Funds will be used for plants, flowers and site setup to meet the high demand for special events and celebrations.

With the extra business coming in for celebrations and special events, Terese has hired a part-time sales person and assistant. In the future, she wants to hire two full-time employees to meet business needs and expand sales and her net income.

loans.use: To open a satellite location .

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha vive en el municipio Valle De Las Zapatas, es un lugar alejado de la ciudad en donde residen muy pocas personas. Martha tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos que no depende de ella. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde ofrece una variedad de productos, trabaja todos los días de la semana pues tiene que levantarse temprano para realizar todos los quehaceres del hogar y atender a sus clientes su jornada empieza desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Se encuentra realizando este crédito con el fin de invertir en granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Martha lives in the Valle De Las Zapatas municipality.  It is a place away from the city where very few people live.  Martha is 31 years old; married; and has two children, who are not dependent upon her.

Her business is a general store where she sells a variety of products.  She works every day of the week.  She has to get up early to do her household chores and tend to her customers.  Her working day starts at four in the morning and ends at ten at night.

She will use this loan to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent and juice.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Orquideas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO LAS ORQUIDEAS DE SAN BARTOLO
Doña Maria como la llaman sus clientes es una socia que se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de frutas y flores  ella nos comenta que tiene su propio vivero en su casa y que ella sabe en qué tiempo le da cosecha cada una de sus flores, actualmente se dedica a la venta de orquídeas,  que es un proyecto que llego a su comunidad y que eso la ha ayudado mucho para dar a conocer más su producto y lo que más le alegra es que es un producto que es mejor pagado,  también nos comenta que le gusta mucho el negocio porque eso la ha ayudado  a sacar adelante a sus hijos y que lo que ella mas anhela es que sus hijos logren cerrar sus carreras con ayuda de su esposo,Solicita el credito para compra de flores,  doña Estela Hernández también se dedica a la venta de frutas de su comunidad, donde con ayuda de su hija mayor atienden a sus clientes  ella nos comenta que gracias a la ayuda de Fape a logrado surtir mas su negocio y su anhelo es también seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos Solicita el credito para la compra de frutas
texts.en:
“Duo Las Orquideas de San Bartolo” (The Orchid Duo from San Bartolo)

Maria, as her customers call her, is a member who has devoted herself to the business of fruits and flowers for several years.  She tells us that she has her own nursery at her house.  She knows when to gather each one of her flowers.  She currently sells orchids.  This is a project that came to her community, and it has helped her a great deal to better know her product.  What pleases her the most is that it is a product that pays better.  

She also tells us that she likes her business a lot because it has helped her get her children ahead.  Her greatest desire is, with help from her husband, to ensure that her children have careers.  She is requesting the loan to buy flowers. 

Estela Hernández also sells fruit in her community.  Her oldest daughter helps her wait on her customers.  She tells us that, thanks to help from Fape, she has managed to stock her business more.  Her wish is also to continue giving her children an education.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruit.

loans.use: To buy flowers and fruit to sell

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario de 18 años, es un joven emprendedor que siempre ha querido trabajar para tener su propio dinero por eso su primer trabajo fue vender legumbres en un mercado ubicado en el bloque 6 de “Flor de Bastión”. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana trabaja ahora en su propia tienda ya que el esfuerzo que dio hace años atrás le ha dado resultados no solo con su dedicación sino también con la ayuda de su papa que realiza esta actividad de vender víveres. Actualmente trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 12h00 del medio día. Vende víveres como arroz, legumbres, granos, aceite etc. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio para seguir reuniendo dinero por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, legumbres. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio con abundante mercadería.
texts.en:
Mario, age 18, is an enterprising young man.  He has always wanted to work to have his own money.  His first job was selling vegetables in a market at block 6 of Flor de Bastión.

Living in a periuban zone, he now works in his own store.  The effort that he made years ago has given him results.  With dedication and help from his father he sells provisions.

He currently works from 5:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.   He sells provisions like rice, vegetables, grains, and oil, etc.  He wants to continue with his business in order to keep on saving money.  He wants to use the loan to buy rice and vegetables.  In the future he wants to expand his business with abundant merchandise.

loans.use: Rice and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es soltera  y es la última de cuatro hermanos mayores, es por esta razón que aún vive en la casa de sus padres.Ella trabaja  como proveedora de materiales de construcción (cemento, fierros, alambres, clavos y pinturas) para la exitosa constructora que tiene su padre, dedicada al rubro de construcción de viviendas y obras públicas en toda la ciudad. Y por  esta razón, ella forzadamente tuvo que aprender a conducir el auto de su progenitor, con el que ahora se encarga de suministrar los materiales de construcción en cada obra que realizan. Le gusta su labor  ya que superó sus problemas de transportar los materiales, pero lo que aún la tiene muy preocupada, es que su carro consume mucho combustible. Es por esta razón que ha pensado en  convertir el sistema  de su vehiculo, por el de gas, de ese modo calcula que ahorraría bastante. Para el futuro  anhela comprarse su propio auto y alquilarlo a las agencias, así espera captar  mayores utilidades.Es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socio antiguo de su banco comunal se siente muy satisfecha  ya que gracias a la integridad de su grupo ha recibido constantes ayudas de los integrantes que le han permitido continuar progresando.Rosa tiene planeado invertir  el crédito solicitado en el cambio del sistema de su auto gasolinero por el de gas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and the youngest of four siblings.  For this reason, she still lives in her parents' home.

Rosa works as a building materials supplier (cement, iron, wires, nails and paints) for her father's successful construction company which works on housing and public works construction projects throughout the city.  For this reason, out of necessity, she had to learn to drive her father's car.  She now works with the car, delivering building materials to all the construction projects that they work on.  She enjoys her work since she managed to overcome her problems transporting materials.  However, what still has her worried is the fact that her car uses a lot of fuel.  For this reason, she is planning to convert her vehicle so that it runs on natural gas.  In this way, she calculates that she will save quite a lot of money.  In the future, she would like to buy her own car and hire it out to agencies.  In this way, she hopes to make more profits.

This is Rosa's 14th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member of her community bank, she feels very satisfied since, thanks to the integrity of her group, she has received constant help from the other members who have allowed her to continue making progress.  Rosa plans to spend her loan money on changing her car's fuel system to natural gas.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits and get ahead.

loans.use: To convert her vehicle's fuel system to natural gas

loans.name: Andrea Raquel

texts.es:
Andrea de 53 años, es una mujer que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha obtenido ingresos para comprar un auto pero para poder general más ingresos su hijo maneja el auto como taxi amigo informal. 

Hace 7 años ella compro el auto pero se lo dio a su hijo para que le ayude manejándolo y así obtener más ingresos para la familia ya que trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00 todos los días. El hijo de Andrea cobra por carrera $ 2.00 y si es lejano hasta $ 5.00. Después de obtener el dinero del día él le entrega las ganancias a Andrea para que administre los ingresos del taxi. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con la actividad que hace su hijo ya que su esposo también es taxista pero necesita seguir ayudando con los gastos de la casa por lo que quiere el préstamo para mejorar su vivienda comprando cemento, bloques, pintura. En el futuro quiere comprar otro vehículo para seguir teniendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea, 53, is a woman who through much effort and dedication has earned enough income to buy a car to earn more income; her son operates it as an informal friendly taxi service.

She bought the car seven years ago but gave it to her son so that he would help her driving it thus obtaining more income for the family since it operates from 8am until 5pm every day.  Andrea’s son charges $2.00 per trip and if it’s far away up to $5.00.  He delivers his daily profits to Andrea so that she can administer the taxi’s income.

She has many hopes related to her son’s activity since her husband is also a taxi driver but she has to continue to help meet household expenses and this is why she needs the loan: to do some home improvements buying cement, concrete blocks and paint.  In the future she’d like to buy another vehicle to continue generating income for her family.

loans.use: For cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Carmen Paola

texts.en:
38 year old Carmen Paola is separated and has one child. She lives in a brick house with all the basic services in an area called Paraiso, located on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil.  

She used to live in Puyo in the province of Pastaza, located in the Ecuadorian Amazone. Later she moved to Guayaquil. She has a business providing phone services: national and international calls; and she also sells prepaid cards for cell phones. She works from Monday through Sunday. The main difficulty Carmen Paola deals with in her business is delinquency. 

This is Carmen Paola's first loan through D-MIRO and she plans to use the $1,000 to buy another phone booth and a computer.

loans.use: To buy a new phone booth and a computer for her call center service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Rosibel Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Rosibel V. C. tiene la edad de 39 años, ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, apoyándole a los gastos que la familia incurre en el mes, ellos son una familia con 3 hijos, el cual el mayor le apoya en los trabajos del campo, una vez que tiene tiempo para atender a sus estudios, todos se dedican a los estudios y tienen muchas aspiraciones de culminar una carrera profesional, ellos son Agricultores desde hace mas de 20 años; tiempo en el que se han enfrentado a diferentes infecciones por plagas, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra fungicidas y fertilizantes que permitan un mantenimiento Fitosanitario optimo que mejore las cosechas y erradique el problema de las plagas, puesto que ha afectado la producción y economía del hogar, con esta inversión podrán tener los recursos para suplir con el gasto educativo de sus hijos que es para ellos como padres de familia de una prioridad a sus vidas y satisfacción de poder apoyar con los objetivos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosibel V. C. is 39 years old.  She is married and sells fruits and vegetables to help with the monthly family expenses.  Together they have three children.  The oldest son helps with the work in the field, once he is finished attending to his studies.  They all have aspirations of starting professional careers.

They have been farmers for more than 20 years, during which they’ve had to deal with various crop blights, so they are asking for this loan in order to buy fungicide and fertilizer, because [the blights] have affected the production and financial state of the home.

This investment will allow them to generate the money needed to pay for their children’s educational expenses because helping their children achieve their goals is a priority for their satisfaction as parents.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Placida and she is 45 years old.  Placida is married and has six children. She is requesting the loan to invest in her bread making business.  The city of Oropesa, Peru is famous for making bread and she is interested in using the loan to buy flour, yeast, wood, and other ingredients to make bread.  She also wants to buy firewood to fire her oven.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Bakery / Firewood

loans.name: Kelly Esther

texts.es: Kelly tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13,11 y 7 años en casa de sus padres ubicado en P.J. Nueva Esperanza, ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de productos de belleza y con sus padres tiene un pequeño negocio de licor que les va muy bien ya que en esa zona es un negocio muy rentable,Kelly con sus ahorros y los de su esposo pudo comprarse una moto taxi la cual maneja su esposo ,el Financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para la compra de licor ellos sueñan con poder tener su propio negocio para asi tener un mayor ingreso de dinero y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kelly is 33 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and lives with her husband and three children, aged 13, 11 and 7, in her parents' home which is located in Nueva Esperanza new town.

For several years, Kelly has worked selling beauty products and, together with her parents, she has a small liquor business which is doing very well as it is a very profitable business in this area.  With her savings and her husband's savings, Kelly was able to buy a 'mototaxi' (auto rickshaw) which her husband operates.

Kelly will use this loan to buy liquor.  She and her husband dream of owning their own business so that they can make more income and provide their children with a better future.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Silvio Antonio

texts.es:
Silvio es un hombre trabajador, casado, con una hermosa familia de tres hijos.
Hoy en día trabaja como técnico de pista, con tres años laborando. Lo que para él,  ha sido una bendición mantener su trabajo. Lleva trabajando con Afodenic tres ciclos en donde ha mejorado su vivienda mediante el financiamiento a plazos.
Con este nuevo préstamo hará un muro perimetral, para reguardar su propiedad, a si como proteger más a su familia. Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvio is a hard-working man who is married and has a beautiful family with three sons.  He works at a gas station as has done so for three years.  It has been a blessing for him to keep his job.

He has been working with AFODENIC for three cycles, during which he has been making improvements to his home with the loans he has received.  With this new loan, he will build a perimeter wall around his house in order to better protect his family.  He will buy construction materials like rock, sand, cement, and iron and will begin the project.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a perimeter wall around his house so that his family will be more secure

loans.name: Solidario Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO GUADALUPE

El grupo está conformado por  tres señoras doña Tiburcia T.  inicio con su negocio hace 15 años vendiendo frutas  en la zona 12 de la capital  luego falleció su papa  y le dejo el negocio de frutas dejándole un capital grande  hace  como  tres años ella  se enfermo y decidió ya no vender  más en la ciudad ahora vende fuera de su casa  los días miércoles a domingo ya que su ventaja es tener su venta cerca del campo de futbol  y los días lunes y martes se dedica a la venta de helado  en su propia casa, tiene 4 hijos solteros  quienes estudian por  la tarde, el esposo la apoya saliendo a vender los helados en la aldea donde ella vive, su sueño es que sus hijos tengan un trabajo para que así puedan sostenerse por si mismo. La señora Jesus C.  se dedica a la venta de frutas   desde  15 años en la  zona 12 de la Petapa Ciudad Capital tiene  8  hijos  4 menores de edad y los otros cuatro son casados, el sueño de la señora es tener un local propio. La señora Elsa T. se dedica a la venta de frutas y golosinas  en Galerías del Sur  zona 12 inicio desde  hace 5 años es viuda tiene hijos el sueño de ella es poder tener un local para poder surtir mas y así mismo ofrecer  variedad de golosinas y frutas.
Las tres señoras solicitan el credito para la compra de frutas
texts.en:
Guadalupe Community Bank

This community bank has three female members.

Tiburcia T. set up her business 15 years ago, selling fruit in zone 12 of the capital city.  Then her father died and left her the fruit business and a large amount of capital.  Three years ago, Tiburcia became ill and decided that she would no longer sell her fruit in the city.  She now makes her sales outside her home from Wednesday to Sunday.  Her advantage is that her house is located near a soccer field.  On Mondays and Tuesdays, she sells ice cream from her home.  Tiburcia has four children who are single and study in the afternoons.  Her husband supports her, going out to sell the ice cream in their village.  Tiburcia's dream is for her children to find jobs so that they can support themselves.

Jesus C. has been selling fruit for 15 years in zone 12, Petapa, in the capital city of Guatemala.  She has 8 children.  4 of her children are minors and the other 4 are already married.  Her dream is to own her own sales premises.

Elsa T. sells fruit and candies in 'Galerías del Sur' shopping mall in zone 12.  She set up her business 5 years ago.  Elsa is a widow and has children.  Her dream is to own her own premises so that she can better stock her business and offer a wider variety of candies and fruit.

The three ladies are requesting this loan to buy fruit.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mauricia; ella tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otro tipo de productos, la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mauricia is a member of the “Mama Simona” communal bank, located in the Poroy district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 42 years old, married, has three children, and runs a small grocery store.  She sells primary need products, such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things.  She’s had this business for five years and works together with her husband.  In this way she moves her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan so that she can supply her business with sugar, rice, milk, noodles, and snacks, among other things.  She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su negocio como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, golosinas entre otros más.

loans.name: Jaidy Leonor

texts.en:
32 year old Jaidy Leonor is a single mother. She lives with her two daughters (15 and 2) and one son (11) in Isla Trinitaria in the Southern part of Guayaquil. This area is known for having scant basic services and many dirt roads. Jaidy Leonor’s house is made of concrete and she has water and electricity. 

Jaidy Leonor’s husband left her before her youngest daughter was born. She needed to find a way to take care of her three children by herself so she took out a loan and set up her own business, selling clothes and crafts from door to door, and to friends and family members. 

Luckily things are going well in her business. On average she earns $400/month. Jaidy Leonor hopes to expand in the future and offer a bigger variety of products. She can count on her mother to help her.

Jaidy Leonor plans to use this $500 loan to buy more merchandise, mainly pants and shoes.

loans.use: To buy pants and shoes to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 40 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganados como vacas, ovejas, la socia compra para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes especialmente a los restaurantes de Cusco y Poroy, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en este negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más ganado para así poder distribuirlo a sus clientes y tener más ingresos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Mama Simona” communal bank, located in the Poroy district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married and has three children.  She buys livestock such as cattle and sheep, and then distributes them to her customers, particularly to restaurants in Cusco and Poroy.  She and her husband work together.  They’ve been in this business for years, making it possible to move their family ahead.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more livestock, deliver it to her customers, and increase her income.  She is happy about this loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio Avendaño A. tiene 28 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler  en el barrio San Antonio de esta ciudad de Tarija. Marco es casado y tiene 2 hijos. El señor Marco se dedica desde hace mas de 2 años a trabajar como mecánico de motos. Marco quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante , pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar herramientas de trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de las herramientas para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.   
                                                                                                      
Marco nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo crédito que solicite sera para la compra de mas herramientas de ese modo poder tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio Avendaño A. is 28 years old and lives in a rental house in San Antonio neighborhood, in the city of Tarija.  Marco is married and has two children.  For more than 2 years he has worked as a motorcycle mechanic.  He would like to make more income so that he can get ahead in life but he tells us that he needs to buy some work tools.  He will use this loan to buy tools so that he can increase his income.

Marco tells us that he would like to improve his living conditions.  For this reason, he says that his next loan will be used to buy more tools so that, in this way, he can own his own workshop.

loans.use: To buy tools for his work as a motorcycle mechanic

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Primitiva; ella tiene 45 años de edad, viuda y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de chicharroneria, la socia tiene su local donde vende este tipo de plato hecho a base de chancho, la socia abre desde las 09:00amhasta las 04:00pm, ella trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos que le ayudan cuando ella lo necesita ,la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de Salir adelante siendo esta la forma que tiene para sacar a sus hijos adelante . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como carne de chancho, papas,aceite, entre otros más. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Primitiva belongs to the "MAMA SIMONA" communal bank, which is situated in the Poroy district of Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. 

Primitiva is a 45-year-old widow, with four children. In addition to her daily chores, she runs a business selling "chicharrones" (deep-fried pork). She has a shop, where she sells this type of pork-based dish from 09:00am to 04:00pm. She works in conjunction with her children, who help her when she needs it. She is a very hardworking person and is determined to succeed in this business, which enables her to provide for her children. 

Primitiva has requested this loan, in order to purchase more produce, such as pork, potatoes, and oil. 

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio como carne de chancho, papas,aceite, entre otros más.

loans.name: Martha Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha V. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión joyero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Martha se dedica al cuidado de su hogar y el tiempo que tiene disponible ayuda a su esposo en la realización y venta de las joyas que son de plata y acero, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años, aprendiendo este oficio de su esposo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la realización de sus joyas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Martha V. is a member of the 'Medio Ejido' community bank.  She lives in Cuenca city center.  This city has a cold climate and is known for the architectural beauty of its center.  Its people are very kind and maintain their culture and traditions.

Martha is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 12, 10, 8 and 3.  Her eldest three children study in a school in the city.  Her husband is a jeweler by trade.  They do not own their own home but rent instead.

Martha takes care of her home and, in her spare time, she helps her husband in making and selling his silver and steel jewelry.  She has been in this business for 5 years, learning the trade from her husband.

Martha has been a member of her community bank for one year and she will invest her loan money in buying raw materials for making jewelry.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making jewelry

loans.name: Karina Vanesa

texts.es:
La Señora Karina C. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Karina tiene 33 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad que  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la Terminal terrestre, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Karina se dedica al cuidado de su hogar por lo que sus hijos son aun  pequeños, pero aprovecha su tiempo libre para dedicarse a la venta de ropa actividad que la realiza puerta por puerta.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su mercadería. Su meta es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Karina C. is a member of the Medio Ejido communal bank.  She lives in the Medio Ejido neighborhood of the city of Cuenca, a city with a cool climate and one which is recognized for the architectural beauty of its downtown area. Its people are very friendly and maintain their culture and traditions. 

Karina is 33 years old and has a common-law husband and two children, aged 9 and 5, who attend a school in the city. Her husband works at the bus station. They do not have their own house, so they live in rented accommodations.

Karina dedicates herself to caring for her household, since her children are still small. However, she takes advantage of her free time to sell clothing, which she does by going door to door. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year, and she will invest her new loan in buying more clothing to expand her stock of merchandise. Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: Buying clothing to sell

loans.name: Solidario Trabajadoras De Las Mies Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SEMBRADORAS DE LA MIES
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por doña Jesarela M. B.  ella tiene  6 hijos, 4 son los que viven aun con ella, esta casada,en su casa donde trabaja todos los días haciendo comales de barro desde hace mas de 40 años, también esta doña Celia Regina T. S., ella tiene 28 años de edad y nos cuenta que se dedica a hacer comales de barro y a vender  pollo en las casas desde hace 5 años, tiene 3 hijos y con su trabajo ha logrado apoyar a su esposo para mantener a su familia, también en este grupo esta doña Marta Elisa P. B. quien es la líder de este grupo y nos hace saber que se dedica a fabricar comales desde hace 22 años, tiene 1 hijo y con su trabajo y dedicación ha podido ayudar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su familia, nos cuenta que tiene muchos pedidos por la época que se avecina y es por eso que esta solicitando este préstamo para poder fabricar y a la vez vender  mas comales, y así poder tener mas ganancias,  ella confía en Dios y pide a fape que le puedan dar la oportunidad de superarse con este crédito.
texts.en:
SEMBRADORAS DE LA MIES Community Bank

This community bank has three members.  Jesarela M. B. has 6 children, 4 of whom still live with her.  She is married and works from home every day making 'comales' (special dishes used for cooking tortillas).  She makes her 'comales' from clay.  She has been doing this for more than 40 years.

Another member of the group is Celia Regina T. S..  She is 28 years old and tells us that for five years she has been making 'comales' from clay and selling chicken.  She has three children and, through her work, she has managed to support her husband and family.

Marta Eliza P. B. is also a member of the group and its leader.  She tells us that she has been making 'comales' for 22 years.  She has one child and, through her hard ork and commitment, she has been able to help her husband and get her family ahead in life.  She tells us that she has many orders for the upcoming season and, for that reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can make and sell more 'comales' and, consequently, make more profits.  She trusts in God and asks Fape to provide them with the opportunity to improve themselves with this loan.

loans.use: To make 'comales' (special dishes used for cooking tortillas) to sell

loans.name: Omar Santiago

texts.en:
Omar Santiago is a 32 year old entrepreneur. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children (8 and 9 years old) in Guayaquil, in an area called Orquídeas (an urban area named after the many orchids that existed when the place was discovered). 
Omar Santiago makes duplicate keys. He first worked for another person in the same business. When he realized the activity of duplicating keys is very profitable, he used some capital and started his own business. 
He works alone from 7:00am-13:00pm and from 15:00pm-18:00pm while his wife takes care of the house and the children. He plans to use his $1,000 loan to buy materials and to make some improvements to his store. 
He hopes his children continue with their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy materials and to make improvements to store

loans.name: Diana Anabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana C. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Diana se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que desempeña hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y también se dedica  a la elaboración de empanadas, tamales y dulces que realiza solo bajo pedido.

La Señora. Diana tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene  2 hijos  de 11 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer particular y también labora como arbitro, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y le gusta  ya que tiene muy buenas amigas y han formado un grupo solidó y alegre,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres, ollas y más productos para su negocio. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana C. is a member of the communal bank "Medio Ejido" and she lives in the Medio Ejido neighborhood of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and is known for the arquitectual beauty of its downtown. The people of Cuenca are nice and maintain their culture and traditions.  

Mrs. Diana has sold food for five years from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon.  She also makes empanadas, tamales, and sweets on order.

Mrs. Diana is 34-years-old, married, and has two chiddren ages 11 and 9.  Her first child is in high school and her second child goes to the local grade school.  Her husband is a driver for private clients and also works as a referee; they don't have their own home, so they rent.  
 
She has only been a member of the communal bank for a year and she likes it becuasee she has made many friends and they have formed a solid and happy group.  She is going to invest the loan money in the purchase of supplies, pots, and other products for her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, pots, and other products for the business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
