He prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy an engine and wheels.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. was born on the 06/28/1958, she is married to N. Jacob Fon and they are blessed with six children and live in Azire New Church, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Alice has faced some challenges in life. The most difficult have been the problem of paying for her house rent and building a house of her own.  She plans to invest this loan in frying akra beans, gateau, sales of row food stuff, purchase of sugar, palm oil, groundnut oil, salt, flour and some plates. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least three meals per day at affordable prices.

Alice will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy coki beans, flour, sugar, groundnut oil, salt, and firewood.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Azimjon B. has raised cattle and farmed for 18 years. With 5 children and the responsibility of providing food for his home, he has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals. Today, Azimjon finds himself in need of purchasing cattle in order to be able to take advantage of raising and selling them when necessary. For this reason, Azimjon is obtaining loans from IMON International in order to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Anye

texts.en:
Anye A. was born on 01/02/1947. He is married to Lum Mary and they are blessed with three children and one is under the age of 15. He lives in a small house of three rooms with his family. He lives in Ndamukongstreet, a quarter in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon.

Anye has faced some challenges in life. Amongst which are the inability to meet the basic necessities of his family like clothing, food, transportation and educating himself and his children. He has had difficulties in raising capital to start up a small business to sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a gardening business, and with this loan he is going to buy seedlings and farm products. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took was repaid by the income raised from an old farm of his; therefore, he concludes that he is sure the business will succeed. He is also certain that this business will succeed because the products he produces are highly demanded in the market. The loan will help his community because they will be able to afford all food ingredients at low or no cost. 

Anye will plough back his profit into his business and use part to care for his family. He also will use the proceeds to pay his children’s school fees and cater for the family. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, manure, farm tools, clear farm and buy firewood.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid K., a hardworking gentleman in the cattle-raising business, is married and works hard to provide for his two children. Presently, Rashid is making sacrifices and working hard to grow his business, and now is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise. His goal is to maximize returns from the sale of milk products. This will be Rashid's fourth loan with IMON and Kiva, and his credit history shows that he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe P. M. was born in 1947. He is a polygamist  with seven children, two younger then 15 years. He lives in a small three-room house with his family in Mubang Nkwena quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Ambehas has faced many challenges in life, among them the death of his parents when he was very young, and meeting the basic necessities of life such as clothing, feeding, and educating himself and his children. Also difficulties in raising money to pay taxes for his craft workshop that helps sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a business doing wood carving, selling firewood and raising pigs. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took out increased his income. The wood products he produces are in high demand in the market and he also trains youths in the skill. Ambe will plough his profits back into his business and use part to care for his family including his children’s school fees. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: piglets and feed, fire wood, and wood for wood-carving

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Phebe S. was born in 1954 and has four children, two of them under 15. She works hard for herself and her children, having been abandoned by her husband. With the death of her first son, she was obliged to work very hard to support the rest of the children, only possible with more income, which motivated her to join GHAPE. With this loan, she plans to carry out mixed farming and increase her business selling bananas, fire wood, and palm oil. With the profit from this business she plans to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Phebe will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: yam seeds, bananas, palm oil and fire wood

loans.name: Wilson Mwangi

texts.en:
Wilson has operated his motorcycle in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 30 years old, and married to Annastacia Kanini. Together, they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to renew his PSV licence, buy two new helmets and service his motorcycle.

In the future, Wilson hopes to own a taxi.

loans.use: To renew his PSV licence, buy two new helmets and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nchang

texts.en:
Nchang  was born in 1961, is single and has three children. She shares two rooms with her children in Ndamukong, a part of Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Nchang has faced many difficulties in her life including meeting her own daily needs and the increasing demands of her children. She also has had difficulties of finding adequate capital to expand her business. She plans to invest this loan in farming food crops like yams, and needs to buy manure, farm equipment and firewood. She thinks her business will succeed because her business is accessible and she is friendly to her customers. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her community by reducing the cost of transportation to buy firewood.

Nchang will use a fraction of her profit to provide for the children’s school needs, meet personal needs and feed her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she receives, the follow-up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: buy manure, fire wood, farm tools, and seedlings

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 33 years old. His wife, Leah, is a salonist and produces an additional income for the family. He supports seven people in the family. His firstborn is 11 years old and his latest child is three years old.

He runs an electronics shop. He has been in this business for ten years, and right now his monthly income is Kshs 6,000. He is requesting a loan of Kshs 80,000 which he plans to use as follows: Kshs 65,000 to purchase a motor bike, and Kshs 15,000 to add stock to the electronics shop.

He plans to save the anticipated profits for emergencies and for future use. This is his fifth loan, and he has successfully paid off his previous loans. His plans and hopes are to be a successful businessman, support his family well, and educate his children to a high level.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred M. is 30 years old. He is married to Joan M. and blessed with three children. Alfred is a mixed farmer, and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for mixed farming.

He learnt about KADET through a marketing campaign by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy farming supplies and hire help to prepare the land.

He hopes to use the profits from this loan to expand the business. His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren. Alfred is a painstaking worker, who is capable of achieving more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and hire help to prepare the land.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en:
A. Kamoliddin was born in 1964 in Gonchi, Tajikistan where he works as a farmer. He is married and has two children. His main business is farming and cattle breeding, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Kamoliddin owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle. The loan will greatly improve Kamoliddin’s income and his family's living standards. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary AkwenN. was born on the 6th of August, 1956 is a widow and the mother of four children, one of them under 15. She shares six rooms with her children and grandchildren in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

She has encountered many difficulties in life including the failure to attain a quality education due to the untimely death of her father, and that of her husband in 2006, which has put her into her present state of trying to support her family. In addition, thieves broke into her home and made off with valuable materials and, in 2000, her house collapsed because of heavy rain and wind. With the many problems and the children under her care, she has still been happy because, among  the widows in her area, she is one of those who gets help from GHAPE solving her problems. If given another loan of 400.000frs, she plans to buy day-old chicks, seedlings, and fertilizer. She is convinced that the business will succeed because a previous loan from GHAPE was successful. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide general food provisions so they will not need to incur transportation costs to buy in distant places. 

She will plough her profits back into her business and use part to care for her family, pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. Sthe also hopes to open a workshop for her son.

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she receives, the follow-up, and that GHAPE does not ask for collateral, as well as the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan. 

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy day-old chicks, seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat H. is a market entrepreneur from Istaravshan where she lives with her husband and three children. Rohat is very good with finances. She knows how to manage money and make the right investments.

Rohat has been in the business of selling packages and bags for three years. Rohat is requesting a loan of 1,300 USD to increase turnover capital and generate additional profits as a result. She is hoping to see her venture grow and is planning to buy at least one more vending facility in the market. We believe the current loan will allow her to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her capital in her package and bag vending business

loans.name: Moyiare

texts.en:
Moyiare S. is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of four school-going children. Moyiare is a farmer who has been farming for the last year.

Moyiare learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 40,000 KES to buy seeds and hire help for planting her land. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to hire more land for farming to increase her wheat output and use some part of the profit to develop her plot.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can plant wheat on a larger scale. She believes she is hard working and by having the right resources at her disposal she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire help for planting her piece of land.

loans.name: Topoika

texts.en:
Topoika N. is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of ten children. He is in business construction, and he has been doing this for the last two years. His business is in a strategic place.

Topoika learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, with which he is planning to purchase paints and cement and pay for labor for ongoing construction.

He plans to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.  His hope and dream is to construct more rental houses.  He is a hardworking man, and with the right resources he can do great.

loans.use: to purchase paints and cement and pay for labor for ongoing construction.

loans.name: Grace Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Grace K. is 35 years old, married with four children.Her husband works with China Bridge and Roads Co Ltd which adds to the family income.Grace keeps poultry whereby she buys small chicks rear and sell later at a profit. From this business she earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Grace has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000. This is her first loan from KADET LTD, and she intends to use it to purchase more chicks to rear for resale. She anticipates getting some profits which she will use to purchase layers in order to increase her source of income.

Her hope is to be a successful business lady and be able to provide a better life in terms of finance to her family.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: John Kibue

texts.en:
John is 33 years old and married to Carolyn, who is a housewife. They have been blessed with one child who is 12 years old. John offers welding services in the area of Kirigu market. He has been running this business for the past 8 years.

This is the second loan he has taken from KADET LTD, and he intends to use it to buy a welding machine. If the loan improves the business, he desires to own a big hardware store in the area.

loans.use: John wants to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Begimkul

texts.en:
Begimkul is a married man and the father of five children. He and his wife have been raising cattle for more than 20 years. They produce the income which allows him to feed his family. In addition to caring for his livestock, he also cultivates wheat and onions, which help with the family's diet and provide additional income. Begimkul has asked for this loan to buy calves in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm, by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing area for his livestock.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.en:
H. Gulomjon is 25 years old and lives with his parents. For the past five years, he has dedicated himself to farming wheat and onions, as well as breeding cattle. Gulomjon enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious part of farming is the preparation of land for planting and protecting crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Gulomjon also operates a taxi service in his free time. This is his first loan from IMON International. He will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops, and calves. Gulomjon thanks all who support him.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and calves

loans.name: Loyce Njoki

texts.en:
Loyce has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years.  She is 55 years old and married to Paul Ronge, and they have three children.

Loyce was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her second loan.  She repaid her first loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the new loan amount to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Loyce plans to practice large scale farming, employing technology to better her produce.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Iriskul

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort. It requires exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. For the past 15 years, Iriskul has dedicated himself to breeding cattle, a business which supports his humble family. Currently, Iriskul has turned to IMON International for a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale to add to his business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
J. Muhabbat is a 44 years old woman. She is married with 3 children. Since the time she first married she has worked in the business of buying and selling sheep. Muhabbat travels through the farms andnearby settlements to buy sheep at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits. She currently has 2 sheep which she will fatten for some time to later sell. With the loan Muhabbat wants to buy sheep and feed for them. This will be her first loan with IMON International and an evaluation has shown that she is qualified to receive the loan. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchase sheep and feed for them

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en: Jehad is a 39-year-old married man from Gaza, who lives with his wife and three children. All of the children are in school. In 2008, Jehad opened his own computer store in which he sells new computers and fixes old computers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy new computers and laptops for his store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income. This will have his family living a better life.

loans.use: To buy new computers and laptops

loans.name: Faida

texts.en: Faida is 30 years old, married and has one child. Faida sells clothes and has been selling clothes for 10 years. Her husband works as a laborer. Faida will use the loan to purchase more clothes to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Faida plans to build a residential house. She would like to own a booming business and become a sole supplier of clothes in the future.

loans.use: To add more supplies of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gervais

texts.en: Gervais is 35 years old, married and has two children.  Gervais owns a motorcycle for transportation. He has been doing this transportation business as a motorcycle taxi for ten years. His wife is a  sells gasoline. Gervais will use the loan to purchase an additional motorcycle for transportation. With the new profits from his expanded business Gervais plans to repair his older motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a vegetable stall at the market. She is 30 years old and married to a taxi driver motorcyclist. She has three children who are between four and eight years old. 

With the requested loan , she would like to buy more vegetables such as tomatoes, eggplant and green beans to sell. With the profits from this business, she will buy a motorcycle for transportation. She hopes to increase the vegetable sales in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise sells beans, sorghum, peanuts and maize. She is 30 years old and married to a businessperson. They have two children who are six and eight years old.

Francoise has spent eight years in this business. She says that her business is very impoortant to the family savings because she has managed to build a house from the profits she has earned. She requested this loan to buy more beans and tomatoes to sell. With the profits from this business, she will increase the sales as well as set up a new construction project. She will also save some of the loan for her children’s school fees. She hopes to become a food product supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and beans to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael Oyago is 58 years old from Usenge and is married to Susan Atieno. They have one child who is 20 years old. Michael's wife sells vegetables which enables her to help support her husband in catering to the family's needs.

Michael has a poultry business that he has been running for the past 13 years and has seen his business grow in this time. Michael is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD as he wants to buy more poultry to add to his stock. He has huge demand from his clients and the money will enable him to meet this demand. The profits made from it will be used to boost his wife's vegetable business and this will help them improve their family's living standards.

He hopes to have a big poultry farm in the coming years.

loans.use: Buy poultry to add to his stock

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old, married with four children who are aged between four and ten. Two of her children go to school while others are still young. Her husband works with her as well. Esperance sells different items in her shop such as cooking oil, salt, soap, sweets and onions. She has been doing this business for a period of eight years. She praises her business that contributed much to satisfy her daily needs. She says that this loan will be used to add more items in her business and the profits anticipated will be used to buy livestock and a garden. She would wish to set up a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as cooking oil, salt, soap, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad D. is a 23 years old young man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, Muhammad is a working student, he works to pay for his education fees. Muhammad came to FATEN and took a loan to pay for the last semester tuition fees as he can't work for the same long hours previous years since he is doing the last semester but it's gonna be easier for him to repay FATEN a smaller amount on monthly basis.

Muhammad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office in Jabalia branch.

loans.use: Pay off last semester tuition fees

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Patient” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age thirty-five; she was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a school teacher and her children are attending primary school. For ten years now, Fatmata has been selling cosmetics, toothpastes and brushes, clothes, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys cosmetics, toothpastes and brushes, clothes, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Constance Nyevu

texts.en:
Constance Nyevu K. is 23 years old and lives in Tezo in Kilifi. She is married and they have one child. Constance’s husband brings in additional income from his carpentry business. 

Constance owns a food kiosk and has been in this business for the last six years. Her business is doing well. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase flour, maize meal, cereals and cooking oil. 

The anticipated profits will be used to open another food kiosk. Constance's dream and hope is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: Purchase flour, maize meal, cereals and cooking oil

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali K. is 49 years old man, who lives in the South-Eastern part of Azerbaijan, in an area called İmishli. He is married and has four children who are all adult. His wife helps him in his sheep-breeding business which Ali decided to start three years ago. Farming is his only source of income and it helps improve the living standards of family. The monthly income now is 300 AZN. He requested a loan in 800 AZN from Agroinvest and Kiva to buy ten sheep. This is his first loan. His goal for the future is to breed 100 and more sheep.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 28-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and three children. One of the children has entered school.  In 2009, Alaa opened his own carpentry business. He is now hoping that with this loan, he will be able to buy all the equipment that he needs for his carpentry store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy equipment needed for his carpentry store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of selling at hotel and is requesting a loan to to increase her capital and buy more flour.  Mary is 31 years old and is married with a husband that is a driver. She has five children and four of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot.

loans.use: to incerase her capital and buy more flour for use in her hotel

loans.name: Go Befo Group

texts.en:
M’balu D. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. M’balu was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone, twenty-five years ago. She is married to a policeman and the couple has one child. For six years now, she has been selling body lotions, sprays, shampoos, etc. 

This is the first loan that M’balu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. M’balu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business she will buy creams, sprays, shampoos, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buys creams, sprays, shampoos, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif A. is a cattle breeder since 2005. He was born in 1955 in the Saatli region. Vaqif is married and is responder for four people consisting of his wife, two daughters and a son. This is his first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva. He has requested this loan of 1000 AZN to purchase three more cows. Vaqif sells dairy in the Saatli bazaar and income helped improve the livelihood of his family. This is the only source of income for family. His elder son actively helps him in it. Vaqif plans to improve his dairy farming in the future by buying more dairy cows that will increase his income. Vaqif is very thankful to Aqroinvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy three cows and feed for them

loans.name: Fambul Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in the village of Yele, in northern Sierra Leone, twenty-seven years ago. She is married to a motor-bike taxi driver and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. For four years now, she has been selling gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice, pants, shirts, etc. 

This is first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy gari, rice, pants, shirts, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Saber

texts.en: Saber is a 22-year-old single man from Gaza. In 2004, Saber opened his own grocery store. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to buy new supplies for his store in order to improve his store and be able to bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en:
Nadi is a 29 years old man from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, Nadi is married and a father of two sons and two daughters. Nadi had health complications recently and he needed to do different types of tests to diagnose the breathing problems he had.

Nadi is a decent employee in the municipality and he couldn't pay off the cost of the tests all at once therefore he took the loan from FATEN and paid it as it's easier for him to pay monthly smaller amounts of money for FATEN.

Nadi appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch

loans.use: Pay off personal medical expenses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary W. is a single lady who is 26 years old and lives in the Nyamasaria area. She does her business in the Nyamasaria area in the outskirts of Kisumu City.

Mary has a grocery store which she has run for the past year. Mary needs to add apples, mangos, lemons, sweet melons, watermelons and oranges to her stock. She is therefore applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. The proceeds from this business will be invested back into the business.

Her desire is to own a big grocery store in the future and own rental houses.

loans.use: Buy mangos, sweet melons, and watermelon to add to stock

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar H. is a 57 year-old hardworking man living in Saatli, with his family. Safar has three sons and all of them are adult. He is a farmer who has engaged in sheep-breeding business and has been in this practice for four years. This business is the only source of income of the five-member family. It had enabled him to pay school fees for his children. His business plan is to become a big farmer owning at least a hundred sheep. That is why Safar has requested a loan of 1000 AZN through Aqroinvest and Kiva to buy ten sheep. This is his first loan. He is thankful for support since this loan allowed him to have better results in his business. He dreams of opening farm and improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep

loans.name: Money Finders Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Money Finders” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Baby S. is the leader of this group. The twenty-seven-year-old is married to a building contractor and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Baby has been a businesswoman for five years now, she sells market-food – palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, rice, oil, tomatoes, salts, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy palm-oil, margi, salt, rice, oil, tomatoes, salts, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita Y. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old. Marianita is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Marianita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marianita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Marianita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the fishing business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of distilling alcohol and tea boiling and is requesting a loan for buying more sacks of sugars and floor to distilation.  Mary is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a carpenter. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to paying school fees and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: for buying more sacks of suger and floor for distilation

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol. she requested a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. Julia is 30 years old and married to a businessman . She has 4 children and 3 of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to pay school fees for her children and buy land to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Isaya Okuno

texts.en:
Isaya O. is 35 years old from Awendo in Migori Town. He is is married to Millicent, who has a retail shop.

Isaya is a carpenter and has been running his business for the past 12 years. He is known for making good furniture in his neighborhood and has thus created a huge clientele list. He is applying for his fifth loan from KADET LTD and wants to use the money to buy more timber to add to his stock. The profits made will be used towards his family's needs and to pay school fees for his children.    

His desire is to see his business expand and to be able to build a big workshop. He also hopes that his business will generate enough income to enable him to cater to the family's needs, thus improving their living standards.

loans.use: Buy timber to add to his stock

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla S. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 55 years old. Priscilla is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Priscilla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Priscilla has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Priscilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Priscilla is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Priscilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is a 34-year-old married man from Gaza who lives with his wife and four children. In 2005, Alaa opened his own electronics shop and is now hoping that through this loan he will be able to buy all the electronics needed for his shop. He hopes that this will bring him more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy all the electronics needed for his store

loans.name: Benibethel

texts.en:
Benibethel B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 21 years old. Benibethel is single. To make a living, Benibethel owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is very thankful because she believes the profit she will make from this expanded business will allow her to improve the living conditions for her family.

Jihad took a loan from FATEN to fix his house and prepare it for the winter season.  This work included fixing the doors and widows, mending the roof, stopping water leakage, etc.

Jihad, who appears in the picture here, is a company employee and makes a decent salary.  However, that income does not pay for all the above expenses at once.

texts.en:
Goyush P. is a 52-year-old man. He is married and is an attentive father of three sons. In order to support his family and find an additional source of income, he decided to start his own business in cattle breeding in 2003. Now, this business has become the only source of income for the family, bringing in about 300 AZN a month. 

Goyush had applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to expand his farm by purchasing two cows. This is his first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva. With the additional income, he plans to increase the number of cattle up to seven cows – currently he has four cows. 

Goyush sells his dairy products in the Sabirabad bazaar. He also grows poultry for family use. He is a very responsible and hard-working man. In the future, Goyush plans to improve his dairy and meat sales, and to provide more money for himself and his family.

loans.name: Amistad Eterna Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Amistad Eterna, es un grupo de 9 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Senkata, están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos, como ser: venta de carne de oveja, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio venta de dulces, venta de ace y jabón, venta de refrescos, venta de comida.
Para su organización, la B.C.  Amistad Eterna cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Basilia, una tesorera, la señora Bartolina y una secretaria de actas, la señora María.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Basilia, es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus seis hijos.   El negocio de la señora Basilia es la venta de comida, ella comenta que inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia hace cinco años atrás. Actualmente vende comida a las siete de la mañana, todos los días, en un lugar llamado puente Vela en la Zona de Senkata.  La señora  Basilia recibe colaboración de sus hijas para la venta de la comida.
La señora presidenta está ingresando como cliente a Pro Mujer por primera vez, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde "la capacitación".
texts.en:
The communal bank  Amistad Eterna is a group of 9 women who have decided to unite to receive loans, training, and medical care. This communal bank is part of the focal center of Senkata and they're beginning their first loan cycle. 

Each member has her own distinct business, including: sale of lamb meat, sale of groceries, a neighborhood sweets shop, sale of oil and soap, sale of soft drinks, and food sales. 

In terms of organization, Amistad Eterna is directed by a committee comprised of a president, Basilia; a treasurer, Bartolina, and a secretary, María. 

The president, Basilia, is 36-years-old. She lives with her husband and six children. She sells food, and she says that she started the company with her own initiative five years ago. Currently she sells food at 7 a.m. everyday in a place called Puente Vela in the Senkata area. Basilia's daughters help her sell the food. She's joining as a client of Pro Mujer for the first time. What she likes most about the institution is the training.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zargila

texts.en:
Zargila I. is 52 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Imishli. All her children are adults and help in her cattle-breeding business. Zargila started her business in 2003 and has gained a lot of experience as a farmer. Previously, their only source income was a monthly pension in the amount of 100 AZN.  But Zargila is a hardworking woman. She sells dairy and meat at the local bazaar. Now, the monthly income for the family is nearly 300 AZN. 

This is Zargila's first loan with AqroInvest through Kiva. With this loan for 1000 AZN, Zargila was able to buy three more cows. Now she has six cows. Zargila says that this loan has helped her expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. After repaying this loan, she would like to take out another loan to buy seven more cows.
