texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “KILLA”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac,  provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olga; La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica  a prestar servicio de llamadas telefónicas a diferentes destinos dentro del país a celulares y teléfonos fijos locales. La socia realiza llamadas a celulares de preferencia, ella recarga sus 4 teléfonos celulares con diferentes montos y los alquila a 0.50 céntimos el minuto, la socia trabaja en este oficio tres años y es de mucho apoyo para ella , la socia trabaja en la esquina de la av.sol y Almagro ella junto a otra señora tienen su mandil fosforecerte verde el cual las identifica, ella desea el crédito, para recargar sus teléfonos celulares. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de recargas para sus teléfonos celulares.

Los otros socios se dedican a la administración de su restaurante, a la docencia, al servicio de llamadas por celulares, a la venta de ropa, el único socio del grupo es albañil, enfermero.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Killa communal bank,  located in the Huanchac district in Cusco department and province.

She is Olga, 26.  She has a partner and one child.  Olga has a call center service to various locations in the country to cell phones and local land lines.  She also makes important cell phone calls for customers, recharges her 4 cell phones with different bases and rents them for .50 centimes a minute.  She has worked in this business for three year and this is a big financial support for her.  Olga works on the corner of  Avenida Sol and Almagro with another woman and they have  green phosphorescent aprons that identify them.  She would like a loan to recharge her cell phones.  For this she would like to buy phone chargers.

The other members manage a restaurant, teach, have cell phone call services, and clothing sales.  The only male member of the bank is a mason and male nurse.

The member values the loan and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy chargers for her cell phones

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida A. is from the village of Upper Dicayas,Dipolog City. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Loida operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling salabat in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Loida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ginger for her business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC:


Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase ginger for her business

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de accesorios de computadora, ella es propietaria de una pequeña tienda donde vende repuestos de computadora, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de accesorios para computadoras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  accesorios para computadora.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelida belongs to the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Nelida is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  Nelida divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling computer accessories.  She owns a small store where she sells spare parts for computers.  She serves in her store from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  Nelida would like to expand and improve her business.

Nelida is requesting this loan to buy computer accessories.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet M. 37 years old has been overseeing her beauty saloon business for the past five years in Jinja town. It is a business where the daily trivial round involves hair dressing and plaiting women's hair. M. is happily married with four kids and she says weekly this business generates her shillings 35,000. Because of financial constraints, she has not been able to fully expand. It is for this reason that she is requesting for this loan to open more new horizons for her business. Top on her list is the purchase of a drier and cosmetics.

loans.use: The purchase of dryers and cosmetics

loans.name: Jun Rey

texts.en:
Jun Rey is from the village of Owaon, Dapitan City. He is 20 years old, single and no children. Jun Rey operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising different vegetables and crops. He has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jun Rey joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jun Rey is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jun Rey from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: use to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wilbert; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadoras, el tiene una tienda de fotocopiadora y también trabaja como técnico electricista, el socio por medio de estos trabajos el socio saca adelante a su familia, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de fotocopiadora.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para arreglar la maquina fotocopiadora.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Wilbert is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Wilbert is 38 years old.  He lives with his partner and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his photocopier business.  Wilbert has a photocopier store and also works as an electrician.  Through this work he gets his family ahead in life.  Wilbert would like to expand and improve his photocopier business.  He is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for fixing a photocopier.

Wilbert is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix a photocopier

loans.name: Jhenny Stephany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jhenny Stephany; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de fotocopiadora, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de servicio de fotocopiadora, ella también trabaja en el instituto nacional de cultura como guía, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de fotocopiadora y tipeos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papel al por mayor para hacer las fotocopias.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jhenny Stephany is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Jhenny Stephany is 22 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her photocopying business.  She has a small store where she offers photocopying services.  She also works for the National Institute of Culture as a guide.  She would like to expand and improve her photocopying and typing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy paper wholesale for making photocopies.

Jhenny Stephany is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy paper wholesale for making photocopies

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie T. is from the village of Barra Puntod. She is 45 years old. Elsie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus tres  hijos; pues juntos buscan salir adelante y alcanzar el progreso.Desde hace 10 años, esta laboriosa madre de familia tuvo que integrarse al trabajo de su esposo en apoyo de las filmaciones y tomas fotográficas, que él realiza. Le presta su ayuda pues en ciertas oportunidades su pareja  no se abastecía en brindar los servicios, y en la actualidad si se abastece. Por esta razón Gloria tuvo que aprender a utilizar las máquinas fotográficas y filmadoras, y la labor que ella desempeña  es tomar las fotos de los eventos donde  la contratan, de lo contrario atiende su negocio en su local situado en su vivienda. A lo largo de todos estos años han logrado captar regular cantidad de clientela; y su labor le resulta bastante rentable, por lo que está muy contenta por el éxito del negocio,  pues  su hijo mayor apoya en la edición de video. Es por esta razón que Gloria, piensa adquirir más herramientas para su negocio y para el futuro desea adquirir su propia reveladora de fotografías.Es el 14avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete en pagar  sus cuotas de manera oportuna, para seguir contando con posteriores ayudas, y así continuar progresando en su negocio.Gloria tiene planeado invertir  el crédito solicitado, en la adquisición de  una filmadora digital, para continuar desarrollando su trabajo sin problemas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  Together they work to get ahead in life and make progress.

For 10 years, this hard-working mother has been working alongside her husband, supporting him in his filming and photography work.  She started helping him because he sometimes had opportunities for work but was unable to provide his services.  With Gloria's help, he can now manage.  Gloria had to learn to use photography equipment and video cameras.  Her current work is taking photos at events where they are contacted to provide their services.  At other times she serves in their business which is located in their home.

Over the years, Gloria has managed to attract a decent number of customers and her work is quite profitable.  She is very happy with the success of the business.  Her eldest son supports them by doing some video editing work.  Gloria is thinking of acquiring more tools for her business and in the future she would like to acquire her own photo developer.

This is Gloria's 14th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time so that she can continue relying on loans in the future and thereby continue making progress in her business.  Gloria plans to invest her loan money in acquiring a digital video camera so that she can continue doing her work without problems.

loans.use: To buy a video camera to improve her business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is from the village of Mangidkid. She is 53 years old. Carmelita is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 22nd loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también se dedica a trabajar en un hotel, la socia vende la ropa en forma ambulatoria en las calles de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas, chompas y polos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Maura is 39 years old, single, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  She also works in a hotel.  Maura sells clothes as an itinerant street vendor in the streets of the city of Cusco.  She would like to own a store where she could sell her clothes.

Maura is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as pants, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts wholesale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de librería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia también quiere seguir estudiando para mejorar cada dia mas. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco. 

Mercedes is 40-years-old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children. She alternates between her daily activities and work in a bookstore. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. 

She also wants to continue studying in order to improve more and more each day. She's requesting the loan for home maintenance. She's happy about the loan and promises to make the payments.

loans.use: Home maintenance

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Segundina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el restaurant como carnes, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Segundina is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Segundina is 49 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She works from 7.00am to 9.00pm.  Segundina would like to expand and improve her restaurant.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to cook in her restaurant such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

Segundina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to cook in her restaurant such as meat, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora F. C. tiene 26 años es mujer soltera con dos hijos vive con su madre Pascuala que tiene 55 años, la actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, papaliza haba, tiene 7 hectáreas de terreno en sector de Segunda Candelaria comunidad Jochi Mayu es una familia humilde de poco recursos pero muy trabajadora de la ciudad de Cochabamba están a 66 km,  para ella  acudir al Banco para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil. 

Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. donde la Sra. F. F. C. necesitaba dinero para comprar un ganado lechero en esta época tiene bastante forraje para ganado lechero y así dar leche y queso a sus hijos y por otra tener ingreso económico que le ayudara mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Flora F. C. is 26 years old.  She is single, has two children, and lives with her mother, 55 year-old Pascuala.

Flora's main business is farming.  She produces, potatoes, 'papa lisa' (a native root vegetable) and beans.  She has 7 hectares of land in Segunda Candelaria sector, in Jochi Mayu community.  Flora's is a very humble family with few economic resources but they are very hard working.  Flora lives 66km from the city of Cochabamba.  For her, making her way to the bank to take a loan is a very difficult undertaking.

Flora requires money to buy a dairy cow.  In this season there is quite a lot of fodder for dairy cows.  In this way, she would be able to provide her children with milk and cheese and she would also have another income which would help her to improve her family's finances.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to improve her income

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 47 years old. Brenda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Brenda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal ARCO IRIS, es un grupo de 8 mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Esta Banca Comunal es parte del centro focal de Senkata, están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos, como ser: venta de CD´s, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapas y cosméticos, venta de relojes.
Para su organización, la B.C.  ARCO IRIS cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  MARTHA, una tesorera, la señora VICTORIA y una secretaria de actas, la señora CAROLINA.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Martha, es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su  pareja y sus cuatro hijos.   El negocio de la señora  Martha es el tejido de chompas a mano, ella comenta que aprendió a tejer cuando era pequeña, su mamá fue quien le enseñó.  Formalmente, trabaja en este rubro desde hace ocho años.   Actualmente teje a pedido para tiendas y puestos.   La solicitud que ha presentado es por Bs.2000.-, monto de dinero que le servirá para la compra de una máquina de tejer.
La señora presidenta está ingresando como cliente a Pro Mujer por primera vez, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde la atención médica y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The 'Arco Iris' (Rainbow) community bank is a group of 8 women who decided to join together to access loans, training and health services.  This community bank is part of the Senkata regional office.  They are beginning their first loan cycle.

Each one of the group's members has her own business such as: selling CDs, selling meals, selling beer, knitting blankets, selling 'salchipapas' (traditional fast food) and cosmetics, and selling watches.

The 'Arco Iris' community bank has a board of directors which is made up of a president (Martha), a treasurer (Victoria) and a secretary (Carolina).

The group's president, Martha, is 42 years old.  She lives with her partner and four children.  Martha's business is knitting sweaters by hand.  She tells us that her mom taught her to knit when she was young.  She has been working formally in this business for eight years.  She currently knits to order for stores and other sales locations.  She is requesting a loan for 2,000 bolivianos which she will use to buy a knitting machine.

Martha is a first-time client of Pro Mujer and, when we asked her what she likes about the institution, she replied "the medical services and the savings".

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha; ella tiene 21 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa para mujeres y varones como polos, chompas, polos y pantalones, ella tiene un pequeño Kiosco donde vende la ropa,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Martha is 21 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Martha sells men's and women's clothes such as polo shirts, sweaters and pants.  She has a small stand where she makes her sales.  Martha would like to expand her business and is requesting this loan to buy clothes wholesale.

Martha is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes wholesale

loans.name: God Gee Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “God Gee” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Hawa C. is the leader of this group. The twenty-two -year-old is married to a businessman and they have one child. Hawa has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells palm-oil and rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm-oil and rice at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El cliente surtirá mercancía para su negocio ya que desea meter variedad de abarrotes pues dice que el es un hombre de 40 años y que se a dedicado a cuidar a su padre ya que a raíz de que el papa de Juan  Tubo una embolia pues el dejo su trabajo en la fabrica de costura para poder así ayudar a su madre con los cuidados de su padre y vio en el negocio de los abarrotes una fuente de ingresos y en su propia casa y el  crédito le da la opción de meter variedad de mercancía a su negocio.
texts.en: Juan is a 40 year-old man who looks after his father.  His father suffered an embolism and so Juan left his work in a garment factory in order to help his mother care for him.  He saw that a grocery business could be a source of income and so set up a store in his own home.  Juan is requesting this loan to stock his business with merchandise so that he has a better variety of groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Jacquilyn

texts.en:
Jacquilyn S. is from the village of Katipunan. She is 32 years old. Jacquilyn is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquilyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jacquilyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jacquilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jacquilyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Jacquilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saben Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Saben” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in Makeni, thirty-seven years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and two of her children are attending primary school. Isatu has been selling clothes for twenty years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy clothes in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys clothes in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jimmy; el tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de desarrollo de páginas web, el socio realiza diferentes páginas web para diferentes instituciones, el socio quiere seguir estudiando y mejorando para hacer las páginas web. El  socio solicita el préstamo para su uso personal.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Virgen Guadalupe-Cusco Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Jimmy. He is 24 and single. He divides his daily activities with his business, which is developing websites. He makes different websites for different institutions. He wants to continue studying and improving to make web pages. He is requesting this loan for personal use. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for personal use.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy yeast, flour, oil, baking powder, etc., in order to produce a larger quantity of breads for sale

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alvaro; el tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taxi, el hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles del cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir mejorando el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa para comprar alimentos y ropa para sus hijos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Alvaro is 31 years old.  He lives with his partner and has one child.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his taxi business.  Alvaro provides taxi services in the streets of Cusco.  He works from 5.00am to 9.00pm and would like to continue improving his taxi service.  Alvaro is requesting this loan for his household, to buy food and clothes for his child.

Alvaro is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy food and clothes for his child

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edwin; el tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una institución llamada Seda Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere seguir mejorando en su casa. Edwin is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.name: Senkata Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal PLAN 3000, es un grupo de 10 mujeres que han decidido formar esta banca comunal para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  La B.C. Plan 3000 es parte del centro focal de Senkata, están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos, como ser: tejido de chompas, atención de una tienda de barrio, costura de bolsas, venta de comida, venta de tarjetas para teléfono pre-pago, venta de jabones, detergente en polvo y otros, venta de pitas y repuestos de autos.

Para su organización, la B.C.  Plan 3000 cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Nadir, una tesorera, la señora  Teodora y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Silvia.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Nadir, es una mujer joven de  25 años de edad, vive con su  esposo y su hijo.   El negocio de la señora   Nadir es la atención de una tienda de Barrio y también la venta de juguetes.  La tienda de barrio fue iniciado por iniciativa propia hace dos años, la venta de juguetes en el mercado Uyustus, es resultado del aprendizaje que tuvo con el negocio de su hermana, la venta son los días sábado y domingo, todo el día.
La solicitud que ha presentado la señora Nadir es por Bs.1000.-, monto de dinero que le servirá para la compra de juguetes.
La señora presidenta está ingresando como cliente a Pro Mujer por primera vez, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde la atención médica y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The 'Plan 3000' community bank is a group of 10 women who decided to create their community bank in order to access loans, training and health services.  The 'Plan 3000' community bank is part of the Senkata regional office.  They members are starting their first loan cycle.

Each of the group's members has her own business.  These include: knitting sweaters, running a neighborhood store, sewing bags, selling meals, selling pre-paid phone cards, selling soap, detergent powder, etc., selling pitas and selling auto spare parts.

The 'Plan 3000' community bank is run by a board of directors which includes a president (Nadir), a treasurer (Teodora) and a secretary (Silvia).

The group's president, Nadir, is a young woman of 25 who lives with her husband and child.  Her business is serving in her neighborhood store and also selling toys.  She set up her neighborhood store on her own initiative two years ago.  She sells toys in Uyustus market and learned that business from her sister.  She makes her sales all day Saturday and Sunday.

Nadir is requesting a loan for 1,000 bolivianos to buy toys.

As a new client of Pro Mujer, when we asked Nadir what she liked about the institution she replied "the medical services and savings".

loans.use: To buy toys

loans.name: Foryirra Group

texts.en:
Yeabu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yeabu was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone about thirty-five years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school.

For four years now, Yeabu has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, groundnuts, pepper etc. This is first loan that Yeabu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Yeabu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones. 

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie, handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: Buys palm-oil, rice, groundnuts, pepper etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Avigail

texts.es:
La señora Avigail  Ángel  B. vive en la localidad de Amilcingo en el municipio de Temoac en el estado de Morelos, México.  Ella tiene 34 años de edad no concluyó la educación básica estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y su crédito lo va a utilizar para adquirir mercancía de abarrotes en general para surtir su negocio.  Ella tiene un establecimiento de tienda de abarrotes en su localidad, los productos que principalmente va a comprar son: Aceite, azúcar, huevo por caja, jabón, botanas y refrescos, botellitas de agua purificada, cloro, papel higiénico etc. Su tienda se llama “abarrotes Amilcingo", ella aprendió el negocio por necesidad para complementar el gasto familiar, el negocio es herencia de sus suegros le heredaron a su esposo, su negocio está en su casa están en el mismo predio por lo cual no tiene que trasladarse, esta situación le conviene mucho porque tiene tiempo para dedicarse también a las labores del hogar. Su negocio es importante porque es el sustento de su familia y le da gusto atender a sus clientes. Lo que más orgullo le da es saber que su negocio va progresando. Ella atiende entre 40 y 50 personas de todas las edades, uno de los desafíos que ha enfrentado su negocio es la economía hay poco dinero y la competencia y esto la ha afectado en sus ingresos y en que a veces no le alcanza para surtir bien su tienda, sin embargo va saliendo para lo indispensable. Además otra problemática que enfrenta es el aumento de negocios de abarrotes en su localidad, por eso solicito el préstamo  para meter más producto y poder comprar de mayoreo y dar mejor precio a sus clientes.
La señora Avigail es casada, su esposo trabaja con ella, le ayuda a atender  la tienda y a veces va a  hacer las compras. Tiene tres hijos y viven todos en su casa ellos son: Lucas de 17 años de edad estudia el bachillerato, Ángel de 15 años de edad estudia la secundaria y Kimberly de 13 años de edad estudia la secundaria, solo ellos viven en su casa, todos colaboran en el negocio, de esa manera aumentan sus ingresos. Sus planes para el futuro son ampliar su casa, construyendo un 2º. Piso,  remodelando su patio y también amueblar su casa. La señora Avigail menciona sentirse contenta por recibir su préstamo, porque de esta manera va a poder cumplir sus metas y ayudar a sus hijos a que tengan una carrera profesional y salgan adelante. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por el préstamo y les agradezco por ser una institución que ayuda a la gente de bajos recursos”.
***ella aparece en la foto junto con su esposo***
texts.en:
Avigail Ángel B. lives in Amilcingo, in the town of Temoac, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 34 years old and didn't finish her basic education.  She studied up to the 5th year of elementary school.

Avigail owns a grocery store and she will use her loan to acquire merchandise (general groceries) to stock her business.  She has a grocery store in her town and the main products that she will buy are: oil, sugar, trays of eggs, soap, snacks, soft drinks, bottles of water, bleach, toilet paper, etc.  Her store is called "Abarrotes Amilcingo" (Amilcingo Groceries).  She learned the business through necessity as she had to cover her family's expenses.  Her business is an inheritance from her in-laws who passed it on to her husband.  Her business is located in her home which means that she doesn't have to travel.  This situation is very convenient for her since she thereby also has time to look after her housework.  

Avigail's business is important because it supports her family and she enjoys serving her customers.  What she is most proud of is knowing that her business is making progress.  Avigail serves between 40 and 50 people of all ages.  One of the challenges she has faced in her business is the economy (there is little money) and the competition.  This has affected her income and sometimes she can't manage to stock her store well.  However, she continues to provide essentials.  A further problem she faces is the rise in the number of grocery businesses in her town.  She is requesting this loan so that she can offer more products and buy wholesale so that she can provide her customers with goods at better prices.

Avigail is married.  Her husband works with her and helps her to serve in the store.  He sometimes also goes to do the shopping.  Avigail has three children and they all live with her.  Her children are: 17 year-old Lucas who is studying for his high school diploma, 15 year-old Ángel who is in high school and 13 year-old Kimberly who is also in high school.  They all help with the business and thereby increase their income.  Avigail's plans for the future are to extend her home, building a second level, remodeling her courtyard and also buying furniture for her house.  Avigail mentions that she feels happy to be receiving this loan because, in this way, she can achieve her goals and help her children to become professionals and get ahead in life.  She would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for the loan and I am grateful that you are an institution that helps people with few economic resources".

Avigail appears in the photo together with her husband.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, eggts, soap, snacks, drinks, bleach, toilet paper, etc. to stock her business
