loans.name: Rutila Regina

texts.es: La señora Rutila Regina García E. se encuentra localizada en la comunidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos México,  ella tiene 37 años de edad, estudio la primaria, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos Uribe de 22 años de edad trabaja, Alexander de 20 años de edad trabaja, Cesar de 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria, Yadira de 5 años de edad está en preescolar. La señora Rutila tiene su negocio de taquería se llama Taquería el Fogoncito 3 ofrece a sus clientes tacos, alambre, tortas. Ella va a comprar con su préstamo carnes, verduras, gas por mayoreo para surtir su negocio y vender sus tacos, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años ella trabajaba de empleada en una taquería y fue aprendiendo viendo como preparaban los alimentos como se maneja el negocio lucharon tanto para obtener el negocio junto con su esposo hasta que por fin lo lograron y se siente orgullosa ver que sus 2 hijos mayores se van a trabajar con ella y tienen su propia fuente de trabajo, su negocio está en Jonacatepec  paga renta se hace 20 minutos se transporta en camioneta  de su casa a su negocio.  su negocio es importante y especial más que nada para su familia y para ayudar a otras familias ya  que es fuente de trabajo para otras personas que trabajan en su negocio, sus clientes son las familias, los jóvenes, los señores, atienden de 80 a 100 clientes por día, su negocio es popular por el sazón de los taquitos, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el clima cuando llueve ya no vienen tantos clientes se inunda afuera en la banqueta que también se ponen mesas, las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir compra mas mercancía, cuando no hay dinero le fian y le dan crédito de una semana para pagar ya cuando hay ganancia paga. Ella está planeando ampliar su negocio meter más productos otros platillos se incluyen en la carta y si les gustan ya se quedan. Su negocio ha ayudado mucho a su familia para la educación de sus hijos, y para los gastos, las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda son construir  casas para sus hijos para que puedan vivir con su familias, ella está emocionada con este préstamo que le proporcionan por que tiene más apoyo para surtir su negocio, las mejoras que desea lograr para sus hijos que cada quien tenga su negocio. La señora Rutila quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “para mí es un gran apoyo que ustedes me puedan prestar, que yo lo voy a invertir en mi negocio, muchas gracias”
texts.en:
Mrs. Rutila Regina G. E. lives in the community of Amilcingo Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 37 years old and she completed primary school. She is married and she has 4 children: Uribe is 22 years old and he is employed; Alexander is 20 years old and he is employed; Cesar is 14 years old and he is in high school; and, Yadira is 5 years old and she is in preschool. 

Rutila has a taco stand named "Taqueria el Fongocito 3" and she sells tacos, shish-kebab, and hamburgers. With her loan she will purchase meats, vegetables, and natural gas in wholesale to supply her stand. She started her business 3 years ago. She was once employed in a taco stand from where she learned to prepare the foods and to manage the business. She and her husband worked hard to have a business together until finally they reached their goal. She is very proud to see her 2 eldest children work the business with her, to have their own source of income. 

The business is located in Jonacatepec. She rents the location. It takes 20 minutes to reach the business from her home when she takes public transport.  Her business is important, especially for her family and other families, as it provides employment to others. 

Her clients are families, young adults, and seniors. She attends to 80 to 100 clients every day. Her business is very popular for the tasty tacos they produce. The challenge that she faces is the weather. When it rains there are many less clients. The sidewalk floods and they usually set tables there.

The earnings from the business are invested in the purchase of merchandise. When there isn't enough money she is able to get things on credit, giving her a week to pay. Her plans are to expand her business and to include more items in the menu and if they are popular, to keep them in the menu. 

Her business is a great help to her family, for the education of their children, and for their expenses. She wants to carry out some improvements to her home and to build houses for her children and their families. She is very excited to have this loan because it is a new way to support her business.  She wants to create a business for each of her children. Rutila wishes to convey to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner) the following message: "the loan that you have granted me is a great help to me. I will invest in my business. Thank you very much".

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice T. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 18 years old. Janice is married and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Janice owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Janice has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janice joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janice is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Janice from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia C. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 60 years old. Lucia is married. To make a living, Lucia owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Lucia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel N. is from the town of Sapangdalaga. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school aged children. Maribel operates a family member's business in the clothing sector, selling RTW's in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maribel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase RTW's for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maribel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase RTW's

loans.name: Lucila Celiflor

texts.es:
La señora Lucila Celiflor T. C. vive en la localidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el  estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, no fue a la escuela. Su crédito lo va a utilizar principalmente para invertir en su negocio. La señora Lucila tiene su negocio de venta de tortillas elaboradas a mano, ella va a comprar con su crédito maíz y leña para tener material para trabajar. Ella  aprendió el oficio desde chica en casa de su mamá, ella aprendió desde chicas a hacer tortillas,  cuando se caso se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar con el gasto familiar y decidió poner un puesto de venta de tortillas hechas a mano junto con sus hermanas. Poco a poco fueron incrementando sus pedidos contrataron  a unas persona para que vendan sus tortilla las llevan a Huazulco ahí tienen muchos clientes. Nos menciona que su préstamo lo va utilizar principalmente en comprar maíz y leña para aumentar la producción de negocio. Actualmente es toda su familia la que participa del negocio, sus hermanas le ayudan a moler y hacer tortillas y un muchacho que contrataron con bicicleta hace las entregas.
Todos los días se traslada desde su domicilio hasta su trabajo a pie se hace 30 minutos ella vive en la horilla del pueblo y se traslada al Centro. Ella Considera que su negocio es importante porque le ayuda a sacar a delante a su familia y que gracias a su empeño le ha ido bien y esto le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida, su parte favorita del trabajo es elaborar las tortillas y le da gran satisfacción saber que mucha gente come sus tortillas que elabora, Mucha gente reconoce su negocio porque les gusta el sabor de las tortillas que son hechas a mano. A ella le da gusto que la gente se lo reconozca. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el aumento de tortillerías, sin embargo menciona que muchas personas prefieren su producto y su clientela no disminuye. Las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza principalmente para invertir en su negocio y para pagar su préstamo. Está planeando en el futuro ampliar su negocio y contratar un o dos personas que le ayuden
La señora Lucila es casada, su esposo es albañil tiene 6 hijos: Hugo de 20 años de edad trabaja y es casado, Cupertino de 18 años de edad trabaja y es casado, Cristian de 16 años de edad estudia bachilleres, Yulisa de 11 años de edad estudia el 6º. Año de primaria y Héctor de 9 años de edad estudia el 4º. Año de primaria. La señora pretende a corto plazo hacer algunas mejoras en su casa como: repellar las  paredes de su vivienda y construir una cocina. También desea construir un segundo piso en su vivienda. Las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que vivan felices.  Su negocio le ha ayudado a complementar el gasto de su casa, la alimentación y para el estudio de sus hijos, ella desea tener mejor ingresos para darle más comodidades a su familia, la señora Lucila quiere decirle a KIVA y a Fundación Realidad  “muchas gracias por los préstamos y espero que sigan ayudado a más gente”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila Celiflor T. C. lives in the district of Amilcingo in the city of Temoac, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. She is 43 years old and she never attended school. She will use her loan to invest in her business. Lucila sells hand-made tortillas. She will purchase corn and firewood with her loan to be able to keep up her business. She learned the business from her mother when she was a young girl. When she married she saw the need to work and to contribute towards the household expenses. She decided to start making tortillas by hand, working together with her sisters.

With time the orders placed became more and later they found some individuals who would sell their tortillas in Huazulco, location where there are many more clients.  Her loan will be used to purchase corn and firewood, to increase production. Her entire family contributes tot he business. Her sisters help her grind the corn and make the tortillas. They hired a young man with a bicycle to make the deliveries.

Every day she walks 30 minutes from her home to where she lives. She lives in the outskirts of the village and she travels to the downtown area. She considers her business very important because she is able to support her family. It is thanks to her hard work that things have gone so well, and it has given them a better quality of life. Her favorite part of the work is making the tortillas. It gives her great satisfaction to know that so many enjoy eating the tortillas that she makes. 

Her business is well known because they like the quality of the hand made tortillas. She likes to know that her business is popular. One of the challenges she faces is the increasing number of tortilla shops. But she says that many people still prefer her products and her clientele have not diminished.

The profits she perceives are used primarily to invest in her business and to pay off her loan. In the future she plans to expand the business by hiring one or two people to help her. 

Lucila is married and her husband is a construction worker. They have 6 children together. Hugo is 20 years old and he is married and is employed. Cupertino is 18 years old, he is married and he is employed. Cristian is 16 years old and is in high school. Yulisa is 11 years old and she is in Grade 6. Hector is 9 years old and he is in Grade 4. 

In the short term she plans on making some improvements to their home, including repairing the walls and building a kitchen. She also wishes to build a second floor to their home. In the future she only wants her children to be happy. Her business has help support the household, buy food, and pay for her children's education. She wishes to improve her profits to provide her family with greater comforts. Lucila wishes to convey to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad the following message "Thank you so much for the loan and I hope you will continue to help more people".

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 37 años, vive con su esposo  Edmundo  (42) y sus  tres hijos, juntos residen  en el distrito de Quimbiri, donde  cuentan con su propia casa.Su trabajo es labrar la tierra junto a su esposo, y durante gran parte del día se encuentran en su chacra. En su parcela cuenta con las plantaciones de cacao, coca, café entre otros y ya esta  trabajando exitosamente siete años, el método de trabajo consiste en diversificar sus plantíos porque cada tipo de cultivo tiene una  temporada determinada  de cosecha es por esta razón  que obtiene dinero de sus distintas plantaciones. En tiempo de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los peones para facilitar la extracción de su producto, y su  planta más rentable es la hoja de la coca pues por cada arroba (que equivale a11.5 kilogramos y medio)  que vende le pagan 120 soles.  El resto de sus plantaciones como el cacao, café entre otros no se comparan con el precio de la hoja de coca; es por esta razón que en el futuro quiere sembrar más hoja de coca porque le permite tener mayores ingresos.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a  seguir cumpliendo puntualmente  con su cronograma de pagos, es por esta razón que se siente satisfecha con el desempeño de su banco comunal, debido a la buena familiaridad  que existe en las reuniones mensuales.Luisa tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en el pago  pagos de los peones; quienes le apoyarán en sus cosechas, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old and she lives with her 42-year old husband, Edmundo, and their three children. They live in the district of Quimbiri in their own home. She works the fields together with her husband, spending a large part of the day in the land. On her land they have plantations of cocoa, coca leaves, coffee and other products, a business they have had for the past seven years. 

The best way to manage a field is to diversify the types of harvest because each type has a specific season to harvest, which is why he is able to have so many different products. 

During the harvest she needs to hire help in order to gather the entire product. The most profitable of all the harvest is coca leaves. For each load of 11.5 kilograms she gets 120 soles. The other harvests such as cocoa and coffee are not comparable in price to coca leaves. In the future she hopes to plant more coca leaves, to increase her profits. 

This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to established payment schedule. She is very happy with her community bank for the great collegiality that exists in the monthly meetings. Luisa plans on investing the requested one thousand soles to hire farm hands. They will help her with the harvests and it will ensure her future success.

loans.use: To hire help for the harvest.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.es: La señora Alfreda L. Ríos es originaria de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 40 años de edad, estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos que van a la escuela, ella se dedica a elaborar y vender dulces de feria, ella va a comprar con su préstamo alegría, cacahuates, tamarindo, miel, piloncillo, azúcar para elaborar sus dulces, ella ofrece a sus clientes alegría, palanqueta de cacahuate, dulce de tamarindo, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años sus suegros le enseñaron a elaborar los dulces, ellos la animaron a comenzar con el negocio y gracias a los prestamos adquirió su negocio, en su casa elabora los dulces y sale a vender a los pueblos sus dulces en las ferias, algunos pueblos están retirados llega a su negocio en camioneta de su propiedad su esposo la lleva, ella sale cuando es día de ferias, sus clientes son las personas que viene de fuera, los peregrinos de vaR. lugares como de Tlaxcala. Su negocio es importante y especial porque ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos para los gastos de la escuela, para la alimentación, la parte favorita de su negocio es salir a vender los dulces a las ferias porque es bonito ir a vender, conocer pueblos y conocer gente, la señora Alfreda está orgullosa con su negocio porque tiene ganancia y compra más cosas, su negocio es muy conocido por los dulces que ella elabora con mucho gusto, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son que van muchos dulceros a vender a las ferias los mismos productos, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para comprar más insumos y no falte la materia prima para elaborar los dulces. La señora Alfreda tiene planeado crecer más en el negocio, comprar más mercancía y lo piensa lograr echándole mas ganas a la elaboración de dulces y a las ventas y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo para comprar lo necesario para el negocio y trabajándolo. Este préstamo le ha ayudado mucho a su familia para salir adelante en el negocio y seguir trabajando. Amilcingo es bonito ella está contenta viviendo aquí, la mayor parte de los habitantes se dedican a elaborar los dulces. Las mejoras que desea hacer a su vivienda es un corredor y sus sueños y esperanzas es tener otra casa, otro baño mejor al que tiene, hacer más grande su casa, las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son que sigan estudiando para que tengan una carrera y ser mejores personas y que estén bien de salud y lo piensa lograr invirtiendo el préstamo en insumos y trabando elaborando los dulces para venderlos. La señora Alfreda quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por hacerme el favor de prestarme, se los agradezco mucho”.
texts.en:
Alfreda L. Ríos is from Amilcingo, Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 40 years old. She went to school until the sixth grade, and she has her elementary school certificate.  She is married and has three children who go to school.  

She makes and sells sweets at fairs.  She will use the loan to buy amaranth candy, peanuts, tamarind, honey, brown sugar, and sugar to make her sweets.  She offers her customers amaranth candy, “palanqueta de cacahuate” (similar to peanut brittle), and tamarind candy.

She started her business 15 years ago.  Her mother and father in-law taught her how to make the sweets.  They motivated her to start in the business.  Thanks to the loans she got, she acquired her business.  She makes the sweets at her house, and she leaves to sell them at the village fairs.  Some villages are far away.  She gets to her business in her own van, and her husband takes her.  She goes on the days there are fairs.  Her customers are people who migrate from places like Tlaxcala. 

Her business is important and special because she has been able to get her children ahead, pay the school expenses, and feed her family.  Her favorite part of the business is going to the fairs to sell her candy.  It is lovely to go to sell, to get to know the villages, and to meet people.  Alfreda is proud of her business because she has income and buys more things.  Her business is well-known for the sweets that she makes with great pleasure.

The challenge that her business faces is that there are many candy sellers going to the fairs to sell the same products.  She uses the earnings from her business to buy more ingredients so that she does not run out of supplies to make the sweets.

Alfreda plans to grow more in her business and to buy more merchandise.  She plans to do this by putting more devotion into making and selling the sweets.  She plans to use the loan to buy what she needs for working in her business.

This loan has greatly helped her family in order to get ahead in the business and to keep working.  Amilcingo is a pretty town, and she is happy living here.  Most of the inhabitants make sweets.   

The improvement she wants to make to her house is a hallway.  Her hopes and dreams are to have another house, another bathroom better than the one she has, and to make her house bigger.  What she wishes for her children is that they keep going to school, that they have a career, that they become better people, and that they have good health.  She plans to achieve this by using the loan for supplies and by working and making the sweets to sell.

Alfreda wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for doing me the favor of lending to me.  I am very grateful to you.”

loans.use: To buy amaranth candy, peanuts, tamarind, honey, brown sugar, and sugar to make her sweets

loans.name: Eleofina Cirila

texts.es:
La señora Eleofina Cirila T. C. vive en la localidad de Amilicingo municipio de Temoac en el estado de Morelos, México.  Estudio el 6º. Año de primaria tiene su certificado. Ella tiene 38 años de edad. Su préstamo lo va a utilizar para invertir en su negocio de venta de tortillas elaboradas a mano, ella va a comprar con su préstamo maíz y leña. Su negocio es la elaboración de tortillas a mano, lleva 2 años con esta actividad. Se organizó junto con sus hermanas para poner el negocio y así tener un ingreso adicional para su familia. Además venden picadas, tlacoyos y surten pedidos para fiestas. Antes de dedicarse a este negocio se dedicó a la venta de perfumería por catalogo Avon y Fuller, pero como no le iba muy bien su hermana la invitó a participar en el negocio de la elaboración de tortillas. 
Todos los días se traslada de su domicilio a su trabajo, se hace aproximadamente 20 minutos al centro de Amilcingo en casa de su hermana. Su negocio es importante porque se ayuda con el dinero para la alimentación y los gastos de su casa. La parte favorita de su negocio es hacer sus tortillas y trabajar con su familia porque ve a su mama todos los días. Le da mucho orgullo trabajar junto con sus familiares y que conviven todos los días. Sus clientes habituales son los mismos vecinos de la localidad y del pueblo de Huazulco, en promedio atiende entre 30 y 40 clientes. Ella considera su negocio popular porque las personas buscan mucho las tortillas hechas a mano. Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio es el aumento de tortillerías, lo que hace que su clientela disminuya un poco. Las ganancias las vuelve a invertir en el negocio, comprando más leña y maíz. A futuro piensa contratar un peón para que les ayude con la elaboración de sus productos.
Le señora Eleofina vive en unión libre con su esposo, él no trabaja y es la señora Eleofina la que lleva el gasto de su casa, tiene 4 hijos Chayane de 16 años de edad  no estudia, no trabaja, Iris de 14 años de edad no estudia, Iván de 12 años de edad no estudia y no trabaja y Carina de 10 años de edad estudia la primaria. Solo su hija Iris participa de su negocio ayudándole a hacer las tortillas. Sus sueños son lograr que sus hijos tengan un trabajo para ellos mismos. Se siente feliz con la oportunidad que le brinda KIVA y Fundación Realidad de recibir un préstamo y así poder lograr sus metas, también nos menciona sentirse comprometida con pagar puntualmente. La señora Eleofina quiere decirle a KIVA y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por hacerme este préstamo, gracias a ustedes tenemos este negocio, gracias por los préstamos que me han ayudado mucho”,
texts.en:
Eleofina Cirila T. C. lives in the Amilcingo municipality, in Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She has a sixth grade education, and she has her elementary school certificate.  She is 38 years old.

She will use her loan to invest in her business of selling handmade tortillas.  She will use the loan to buy corn and firewood.  She has been in her business of selling handmade tortillas for two years.  She and her sisters got together in order to set up the business as a way of having additional income for the family.

They also sell cold cuts and “tlacoyos" (fried or toasted cakes made of masa stuffed with refried beans, cheese, fava beans, chicharron or other ingredients).  They also fill orders for fiestas.  Before she worked in this business she sold perfume by catalog from Avon and Fuller.  As this did not go very well for her, her sister invited her to participate in the business of making tortillas.

Every day she goes from her home to her work, which is approximately 20 minutes to her sister’s house in the center of Amilcingo.  Her business is important because it helps with money for food and the household expenses.  Her favorite part of the business is making the tortillas and working with her family because she sees her mother every day.  It makes her very proud to work with her relatives and to share their lives everyday.

Her usual customers are the neighbors in the area and in the town of Huazulco.  They have an average of between 30 and 40 customers.  She feels that her business is popular because people look for handmade tortillas a lot.  One of the challenges that her business faces is the increase in tortilla shops, which makes her have a few less customers.  She invests her earnings in the business by purchasing firewood and corn.  In the future she plans to hire a worker to help her make her products.

Eleofina lives in a common-law marriage with her husband.  He does not work.  Eleofina is the one that takes care of the household expenses.  She has four children.  Chayane, age 16, does not go to school or work.  Iris, age 14, does not go to school.  Ivan, age 12, does not go to school or work.  Carina, age 10, attends elementary school.  Only her daughter, Iris, participates in the business by helping her make tortillas.

Her dream is for her children to have work for themselves.  She is happy with the opportunity to receive a loan from Kiva and the Fundación Realidad.  That way she will be able to achieve her goals.  Also, she tells us that she is committed to paying punctually.  Eleofina wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “Thanks for giving me this loan.  Thanks to you we have this business.  Thanks for the loans that have helped me so much.”

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood to make tortillas by hand

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina Mejía C. vive en la localidad de Amilcingo municipio de Temoac,  Morelos, México. Ella tiene 85 años de edad, ella no estudio,   Su préstamo lo va a utilizar principalmente para invertir en una plantación de cacahuate y maíz que tiene en los campos de cultivo de la localidad, también piensa pagar el trabajo de 2 peones que tiene a su servicio. Además para comprar alimento para 4 puerquitos que esta engordando. Ella lleva 11 años  dedicándose a la agricultura y menciona que los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad le han servido de mucho sobre todo para incrementar sus actividades, pues nos menciona que antes solo se dedicaba al cultivo junto con su esposo, pero ha ido aumentando su trabajo y ahora ya hasta contrata peones para que le ayuden. Antes se dedicaba a vender en las ferias dulces tradicionales en las ferias o en las plazas de Ozumba y Tétela del Volcán palanquetas, alegrías dulce de tamarindo, pero como ahora ya esta grande prefiere no salir de su localidad.
El terreno en el que actualmente vive y en que tiene sus cultivos es herencia de su esposo Normalmente se traslada en la camioneta de su propiedad hasta sus cultivos y en ocasiones también utiliza su medio de transporte para surtir de mercancía de negocio. Sus nietos son los que le ayudan a trabajar en el campo y ella personal mente alimenta a sus cerdos. Ella nos comenta que a sus familiares les gusta su negocio y le ayudan mucho en sus labores. Para ella es muy importante su trabajo porque de este se mantienen ella y sus familiares y además porque contribuyen con su trabajo al mantenimiento de la actividad del campo en su localidad. Le gusta sembrar y ver como sus siembre crece y da frutos y que siempre tiene algún producto en su casa como cacahuate, maíz o alegría.
Sus clientes son mayoristas que en la temporada de cosecha le compran su producción completa para semilla y también conserva algunos costales para vender en la localidad a sus vecinos. Sus ganancias las invierte nuevamente en sus cultivos comprando abono, o para pagar los barbechos de las tierras de labranza. Sus planes a futuro son comprar dos predios mas para la siguiente temporada de siembra y meter sorgo. Algunos de los arreglos que ha hecho en su casa son ampliar la cocina, meter agua potable en su casa.
La señora Florentina es viuda, tiene dos hijas Aurora y Ángela ambas viven con ella y participan de las actividades del campo con su mamá. También viven con ella sus nietos y todos participan de las labores del campo. Nos menciona que gracias a los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familiares y se siente contenta de recibir nuevamente el préstamo para adquirir más tierras y seguir trabajando como hasta ahora. Nos comenta que le gusta su comunidad porque aun se conservan costumbres de sus antepasados y es tranquilo.  Sus palabras de agradecimiento para el equipo de KIVA  son las siguientes: “nos da gusto que los préstamos lleguen a las personas que los necesitan y que nos sigan apoyando con los préstamos”.
texts.en:
Florentina Mejía C. lives in the Amilcingo municipality, in Temoac in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 85 years old, and she did not go to school.  She will use the loan primarily to invest in the peanuts and corn that she has planted in the area’s fields.  She also plans to pay the workers that she has at her service.  Also, she will buy food for four piglets that she is fattening.

She has been farming for 11 years, and she says that the loan from Kiva and the Fundación Realidad have greatly helped her; it especially helped increase her business activities.  She tells us that she previously only worked with crops together with her husband.  But, her work has been increasing, and now she even contracts workers to help her.

She used to sell traditional sweets at the fairs or in the Ozumba and Tétela del Vulcan plazas.  She sold “palanquetas” (similar to peanut brittle), amaranth candy, and tamarind candy.  However, now that she is elderly she prefers not to leave her area.

The land where she currently lives and has her crops is an inheritance from her husband.  Normally she goes in her own van to the crops.  Sometimes she also uses this form of transportation to stock her business with merchandise.  Her grandchildren are the ones who help her work in the field.  She personally feeds her pigs.  She tells us that her family likes her business and helps her a lot with the work.

Her work is very important to her because that is how she supports herself and her family.  It is also important because her work contributes to the maintenance of the fields in her area.  She likes to plant and to see how her plants grow and give fruit.  She always has some product in her house like peanuts, corn, or amaranth.

Her customers are wholesalers who at harvest time buy her complete production for seed.  She also saves some sacks to sell to her neighbors in the area.  She reinvests her earnings in her crops by purchasing fertilizer or paying to prepare the fields.  Her future plans are to buy two more pieces of land for the next planting season and to introduce sorghum.  Some of the repairs that she has made to her house are expanding the kitchen and putting potable water in her house.

Forentina is a widow.  She has two daughters, Aurora and Ángela.  They both live with her and participate in the field work with their mother.  Her grandchildren also live with her, and everyone participates in the field work.  She tells us that thanks to the loans from Kiva and the Fundación Realidad she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.  She is happy to again receive a loan to get more land to keep working as she has been.  She tells us that she likes her community because they still follow the customs of their ancestors, and it is peaceful.

Her words of gratitude to the Kiva team are the following, “It gives us pleasure that the loans go to the people that need them, and they continue supporting us with the loans”.

loans.use: To buy fumigants, pay the workers, and for raising pigs

loans.name: Cristo Rey Ii Group

texts.es:
Andrea Rosario L. L., 34 años D. edad, casada, con 2 hijos menores D. edad y uno por nacer.
La señora Andrea es socia del grupo comunal "Cristo Rey II" y ella junto a su esposo Don William Ataucusi Revilla D. 34 años D. edad estàn dedicados a sacar adelante el proyecto que vienen desempeñando desD. hace algùn tiempo, que es el centro D. estimulaciòn temprana que tienen en su propio hogar. 
El motor y empuje para este proyecto son sus hijos: Italo D. 8 años, Dilan D. 4 años D. edad y su bebe que nacerà en los pròximos dìas.
(En la foto, la Señora Andrea viste D. pantalòn negro, chompa blanca y bufanda roja; es la segunda persona que està D. pie empezando D. la derecha)
El prèstamo lo utilizarà para la compra D. mòdulos (juegos recreativos)para la cuna o estimulaciòn temprana.
texts.en:
Andrea Rosario L. L. is 34 years old and married.  She has two dependent children and is pregnant with her third.

Andrea is a member of the "Cristo Rey II" (Christ the King II) community bank and together with her husband, 34 year-old William Ataucusi Revilla, she works to make progress in the project that they have been working on for some time which is an early stimulation center that they run from their own home.

The drive and motivation behind this project are her children: 8 year-old Italo, 4 year-old Dilan and her baby who will be born in the next few days.

(In the photo, Andrea is the lady wearing black pants, a white sweater and a red scarf: the second person along on the right of the photo, standing up).  She will use her loan to buy items (recreational games) for the crib or early infant stimulation.

loans.use: To buy items for early stimulation

loans.name: Hope To Succeed Group

texts.en:
Salaymatu T. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salaymatu was born in a village call Mayorlow in northern Sierra Leone about thirty years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children – one is in primary school and the other is not of school going age.

For seven years now, Salaymatu has been selling orange, coconut, bananas, plantains, etc. This is first loan that Salamatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Salaymatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business. 

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie, handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy orange, coconut, bananas, plantains, etc. at wholesale to add to her vegetable-selling business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos Alberto; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceites, el socio vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a las diferentes tiendas, el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este trabajo sacan adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para vender.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Guadalupe-Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the Cusco province and department. 

The member is Carlos Alberto. He is 28 years old, is single and has one child. He alternates his daily activities with the business of selling and buying products such as rice, sugar, pasta and oil. He makes his sales as a street vendor taking his products to different stores. He works from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm. Through his work he is able to raise his child. He wants to have a grocery store. He is requesting this loan to buy products to sell. 

He is happy for this loan and he promises to comply with his loan payments.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Onofrio

texts.es: Onofrio, de 45 años; esta casado con Zenaida (46) y juntos tienen cinco  hijos, habitan su vivienda propia que esta situada en el distrito de San Francisco.Onofrio, es una persona con mucho ahínco que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Se dedica al transporte fluvial, y brinda el servicio de transporte surcando  los ríos con su bote, y  transborda personas e mercaderías.  De esta manera viene trabajando 20 años como motorista emergiendo su bote bajo las inmensas aguas del Río Apurimac; en la travesía lo acompaña un ayudante quien se encarga de medir con un asta la profundidad del agua. No se queja de su trabajo al contrario se siente  feliz  por el servicio que presta, pues gracias a su labor  paga la escolaridad de sus hijos y  a la vez ha logrado comprar  tierras para  cultivar. Los  planes a futuro  que tiene para su negocio es adquirir otra canoa para brindarla en alquiler y así obtener mayor ingresos económicos; ademas de empezar a cultivar en mayor cantidad.Es el  13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos puntualmente, además esta satisfecho  con el desempeño de los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues todos son muy solidarios.Onofrio tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  semillas y de esta manera espera mejorar la producción de sus tierras.
texts.en: Onofrio is 45 years old. He is married to Zenaida who is 46 years old and together they have five children. They live in their own home which is located in the district of San Francisco. Onofrio is a person who puts a lot of effort and who fights for the well being of his family. He is dedicated to waterway transport, plying the river with his boat and ferrying people and goods. He has been living this way for 20 years as a motorist emerging from his boat on the vast waters of the Apurimac River.  He is accompanied in this passage by an assistant who is in charge of using a pole to measure water depth. He does not complain about his work but rather he is happy for the service he provides. Thanks to his work he pays for his children's schooling and has managed to buy land to farm. The future plans he has for his business are to buy another canoe to provide it for rent and get more income and to start farming in greater quantities. This is the 13th loan he has received from field partner MFP for which he pledges to continue making his scheduled payments on time. In addition, he is satisfied with the performance of the members of the community bank, they are all very united. Onofrio plans to invest the two thousand soles requested in the purchase of seeds and thus expects to improve production of his land.

loans.use: Purchase seeds to plant his crops.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio solicita el préstamo para su salud para operar su nariz.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen Guadalupe-Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Cusco which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Jhonatan. He is 21 years old and is single. He alternates his daily activities with his business of designing web pages. He designs web pages for different institutions and for the general public. He works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. He wants to keep improving his work designing web pages. He is requesting this loan for his health, to have nose surgery. 

The member is happy for this loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: For his health, to have nose surgery.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olga; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y juguetes la socia vende diferentes artículos de acuerdo a la época ya sea de navidad, día de la madre, día del padre entre otras fechas importantes, la socia vende en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como ropa y juguetes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Olga belongs to the Kantu Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Olga is 46 years old, divorced, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling clothes and toys.  She sells different things according to the seasons like Christmas, Mother’s Day, and Father’s Day, among other important dates.  She sells independently.  She wants to have a store where she can sell clothes.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like clothes and toys.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like clothes and toys

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Verinia; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de una empresa de marketing, ella dicta clases de marketing y también hace capacitaciones, la socia también estudio la carrera profesional de derecho, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su empresa de marketing.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Verinia belongs to the Kantu Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Verinia is 35 years old, married, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with business for a marketing company.  

She presents marketing classes and also does trainings.  She also studied for a career in the law.  She wants to keep improving in her work.

She is requesting the loan to set up her marketing company.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To set up her marketing company

loans.name: Corazon De Angel Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “CORAZON DE ANGEL”, es un grupo de 8 mujeres que han decidido formar esta banca comunal para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  La B.C. “CORAZON DE ANGEL”,  es parte del centro focal de SANTIAGO II, están iniciando su primer ciclo.
Cada una de ellas tienen negocios propios, de diferentes tipos tanto de servicio como comercio.
Para su organización, la B.C. CORAZON DE ANGEL cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Mercedes, una tesorera, la señora  Sonia y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Irma.
 
La Presidenta, la señora Mercedes, vive con su  esposo y sus dos  hijos.   El negocio de la señora   Mercedes es la atención de una tienda de Barrio. La tienda de barrio fue iniciada por iniciativa propia hace tres años, ella se dio cuenta que en el barrio no había tienda y si había demanda de los vecinos.
La solicitud que ha presentado es por Bs. 2000.-, monto de dinero que le servirá para la compra de refrescos.
La señora presidenta ya ha sido socia de  Pro Mujer durante seis años, se encuentra por primera vez, en la B. C. Corazón de Ángel, cuando se le consulta que es lo que le gusta de la institución, ella responde la atención de salud.
texts.en:
The “Corazon de Angel” (Angel’s Heart) Communal Bank is a group with eight women.  They have decided to form a communal bank in order to get a loan, training, and health services.  The Corazón de Ángel Communal Bank is part of the Santiago II regional office, and they are starting their first cycle.

Each one of the women has their own business.  They have different types of businesses ranging from services to commerce.  The Corazón de Ángel Communal Bank has a board of directors.  Mercedes is the president, Sonia is the treasurer, and Irma is the secretary.

The president, Mercedes, lives with her husband and their two children.  Mercedes’ business is working in a neighborhood store.  She started the neighborhood store with her own initiative three years ago.  She realized that the neighborhood did not have a store, and that there was a demand from the neighbors.

She is requesting a loan for 2,000 BOB, which she will use to buy soft drinks.  The president has been a member of Pro Mujer for six year.  This is her first time with Corazón de Ángel Communal Bank.    When asked what she likes about the institution she replied, “The health service”.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Herminia; ella tiene 60 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de profesora en el nivel secundaria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Herminia belongs to the Kantu Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  

Herminia is 60 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her work as a high school teacher.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m.  This work is how she gets her children ahead.  She wants to continue improving in her work. 

She is requesting the loan for her children’s education.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: For her children's education

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia, de 55 años,  esta casada con Donato (60) y también vive con  su joven hijo  Michael (22) y juntos viven en su casa que es propia y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Otilia, es una señora muy alegre y enfocada en sus responsabilidades; se dedica a la atención  en su  bar – recreo que esta ubicado en su zona. En ese lugar ofrece bebidas alcohólicas para el consumo de adultos, además  ofrece platos típicos de la selva como: tacacho con cecina, juane, entre otros, y cuenta con el apoyo de cinco  señoritas dispuestas a brindar una buena atención  a su público concurrente. De esta manera Otilia viene trabajando 10 años y esta agradecida por la preferencia de sus consumidores y los fines de semana cuenta con mayor acogida de público, lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Algunas veces le incomoda cuando sus clientes  beben  en exceso y se salen del límite; pero ella sigue adelante con su negocio. Para el futuro tiene planeado  instalar  una  nueva sucursal con el mismo nombre y la misma zona, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.Es el sétimo préstamo con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente y así desea obtener los mejores beneficios, además en su banco comunal es una socia integra  porque es muy solidaria.Otilia tiene planeado invertir los   mil soles solicitados, en la compra de implementos que le hacen falta en su negocio, como nuevas sillas, mesas, y también desea  brindarle mantenimiento a su negocio.
texts.en:
Otilia, age 55, is married to 60 year old Donato.  They also live with their young 22 year old son, Michael.  They live together in their own house, which is in the Quimbiri district.

Otilia is a very cheerful woman who is focused on her responsibilities.  She works in her bar, Recreo, which is located in her zone.  She offers alcoholic beverages for adults.  She also sells dishes that are typical of the jungle.  Some of the dishes she offers are “tacacho con cecina” (a mass of roasted green banana, chorizo or jerky, oil, lard, salt and pepper, served with grilled jerky) and  “juane” (rice, hen's meat, olives, boiled eggs and spices, which are enveloped in a leaf of bijao and boiled for around 90 minutes), among others.  She has help from five young women who provide her customers with good service.

This is the way that Otilia has been working for ten years.  She is grateful that her customers prefer her food.  On the week-end she has more customers, which generates more income.  Sometimes she is uncomfortable when her customers drink in excess and go over the limit.  However, she keeps going ahead with her business.

In the future she plans to establish a new branch with the same name in the same zone.  This way she hopes to continue moving ahead.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She pledges to keep paying punctually.  That way she wants to get better benefits.  Also, she is an upright member of her communal bank because she is very supportive.  Otilia plans to use the requested 1,000 soles to buy things that she needs like new chairs and tables.  She also wants to provide maintenance to her business.

loans.use: Buy items to improve her business

loans.name: Anonymous

She is applying for the loan in order to purchase inventory at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make all her installment payments.

Juana Aydee is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling mattresses, sheets and bedspreads.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, taking her products to different places such as institutions and also selling to the general public.  She would like to own a store where she could sell her mattresses, sheets and bedspreads.

Juana Aydee is requesting this loan to buy merchandise wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Believe In God” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase profits and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Koloneh K.. Koloneh is age forty. She was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman. Two of her children are attending secondary school and three are already grown-ups. For four years now, Koloneh has been selling cooked rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, firewood, etc. – in large quantity.

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, firewood, etc. – in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa para mujer en el centro comercial El Altiplano, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ana María is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Ana María is 37 years old, single, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling clothes.  Ana María sells women's clothes in the "El Altiplano" shopping center.  She works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  She would like to expand her business and is requesting this loan to buy clothes such as pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses.

Ana María is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes such as pants, sweaters, polo shirts and blouses

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al comercio de venta de cosméticos, con varios años en las ventas para apoyar a su familia.
 Teniendo el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en albañilería.
Al iniciar lo hizo con pocos productos, luego con financiamiento de la institución logro aumentar sus niveles de ventas, la captación de clientes en donde vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. Tiene productos variados, pero invertirá más logrando mejores ingresos.
Con esta nueva solicitud será para invertir en perfumenes de dama, caballeros, polvo compacto, cremas, pinturas labiales entre otros productos de encargo atreves del catalogo.
texts.en:
Dominga is a hard-working woman who sells cosmetics.  She has been supporting her family with this business for several years.  She has the support of her husband who is a construction worker.

In the beginning, Dominga didn't have many products to sell but, through loans from the institution, she managed to increase her sales levels and attract customers who buy her products for cash or on credit.  She offers a variety of products but she will invest more, thereby achieving better profits.  Dominga will invest this new loan in buying women's and men's perfumes, compact powder, creams, lipsticks and other products that she orders through her catalog.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and perfumes for men and women in order to make better profits

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia Alejandra; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de bisutería y venta de hamburguesas, la socia tiene una carreta donde vende hamburguesas en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 3:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de hamburguesas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer las hamburguesas como carne, tomate y lechugas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia Alejandra is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Julia Alejandra is 33 years old, single, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling costume jewelry and burgers.  She has a small cart where she sells burgers as an itinerant street vendor, working from 3.00am to 11.00pm.  Through these small businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.

Julia Alejandra would like to improve and expand her burger business.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making burgers, such as meat, tomatoes and lettuce, wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making burgers, such as meat, tomatoes and lettuce, wholesale

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tejido y venta de chompas, la socia teje diferentes modelos de chompas para mujeres y varones y lo vende en las distintos lugares como en la feria de la Plaza de Tupac Amaru los días sábados y domingos, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender las chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar diferentes colores de lana para tejer las chompas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Doris is 36 years old, single, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business knitting and selling sweaters.  Doris knits different styles of sweaters for men and women and sells them in different places such as the Plaza de Tupcac Amaru market on Saturdays and Sundays.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.

Doris would like to own a store where she could sell her sweaters.  She is requesting this loan to buy different colored yarn to knit her sweaters.

Doris is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy different colored yarn to knit her sweaters

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jessica; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también tiene un negocio de una constructura, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m, por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de constructora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquina mezcladora para su constructora.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Jessica is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She also has a construction business.  Jessica works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through her work, she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her construction business.

Jessica is requesting this loan to buy a cement mixer for her construction business.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer for her construction business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Patricia; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. joyas y también trabaja en una inmobiliaria el negocio D. venta D. joyas lo realiza en forma independiente, ella venD. aretes, collares y pulseras D. plata y oro, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. joyas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar las joyas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Patricia is 53 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling jewelry.  She also works in a real estate agency.  Patricia sells jewelry independently.  She sells earrings, necklaces and bracelets in silver and gold.  She would like to expand her jewelry sales business and is requesting this loan to buy jewelry.

Patricia is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina, D. 50 años, es viuda y tiene dos  jóvenes hijos, Freddy  y Deysi; juntos habitan en su casa que es propia, y esta ubicada en el distrito D. Quimbiri.Su edad no es impedimento para luchar por el bienestar D. sus hijos. Y por esta razón trabaja a diario en su  negocio D. venta D. verduras, cuenta con un puesto en el mercado del distrito D. Quimbiri. Trabaja hace 25 años en este negocio, antes vendía sus productos D. manera ambulatoria; pero ahora lo realiza en un puesto fijo, desD. que la municipalidad D. su zona empezó con la construcción del  mercado modelo. Gracias a ello Sabina y varios  comerciantes en la actualidad  ofrecen sus mercaderías cumpliendo con el reglamento D. las ordenanzas municipales. La venta D. verduras le proporciona buenas ganancias, y para esto cuenta con el apoyo incondicional D. sus hijos quienes están pendientes D. las exigencias D. sus consumidores. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar otro puesto  donD. pueda vender abarrotes y así espera continuar progresando.Es el quinto crédito con MFP, por  lo cual  se compromete en seguir pagando sus cuotas  durante las fechas establecidas, además está contenta  D.  trabajar con su banco comunal, ya que le otorga muchos beneficios.Sabina tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado  en la compra D. mercadería, con el propósito D. abastecer su puesto D. verduras, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina is 50 years old, widowed, and has two young children, Freddy and Deysi.  They live together in their own home which is located in Quimbiri district.  Sabina's age is no obstacle to her working hard for the well-being of her children.  For this reason, she works every day in her business selling vegetables.  She has a stall in Quimbiri district market.  Sabina has been in this business for 25 years.  She used to sell her products as an itinerant street vendor but now she has a fixed sales location which she has had since the local municipality started building the model market.  This means that Sabrina and several other salespeople can currently offer their merchandise for sale whilst complying with the regulations and municipal ordinances.

Selling vegetables provides Sabina with good profits and she has the unconditional support of her children who are always looking out to meet her customers' demands.  In the future, Sabina plans to buy another stall where she can sell groceries and she thereby hopes to continue making progress.

This is Sabina's fifth loan with MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She is happy to be working with her community bank since she receives a lot of benefits from it.  Sabina plans to invest her loan money in buying merchandise with the goal of stocking her vegetable stall.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter; el tiene 47 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, el trabaja haciendo desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar la atención de restaurant. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, carne y verduras para cocinar en el restaurant.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Walter is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Walter is 47 years old, single, and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his restaurant business.  Walter works making breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  He works from 8.00am to 9.00pm and, through his business, he gets his children ahead in life.  Walter would like to improve his restaurant business and is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, meat and vegetables to cook in his restaurant.

Walter is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, meat and vegetables to cook in his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kristell Yesenia; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también se dedica  a trabajar en una empresa constructora y también está terminando de estudiar la carrera profesional de economía, la socia vende los productos de belleza en forma independiente, la socia quiere tener una tienda de venta de cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.     
                                
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Kristell Yesenia is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Kristell Yesenia is 24 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She also works in a construction company and is completing a degree in economics.  Kristell Yesenia sells her beauty products independently.  She would like to own a store where she could sell cosmetics.  She is requesting this loan to buy beauty products wholesale.

Kristell Yesenia is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products wholesale

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es: Venancio, de 60 años, esta  casado con Leoncia  (45)  y tienen cinco hijos; juntos habitan su  casa que es propia, y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Es un hombre trabajador, y  vela por brindar una mejor calidad de vida  a su familia. Venancio llegó de su ciudad natal con el propósito de asentar su negocio en esta zona; él se dedica al negocio de pasamanería pues realiza implementos de decoración confeccionados a base de cordones, borlas o galones, envolvimiento de fundas, cortinas, confección de gallardetes, entre otros. Para realizar su labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos, y su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos económicos porque no existe mucha competencia, y es el único dedicado a este tipo de negocio por la zona del VRAE. También trabaja con diferentes municipalidades donde confecciona gallardetes para el premio de los desfiles cívicos. Su plan a futuro es instalar una nueva filial en el distrito de Pichari, pues desea aumentar su manufactura y a la vez quiere obtener mejores ingresos.Es el 13avo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos, tal como lo hizo en los anteriores préstamos, además esta satisfecho con el apoyo de la institución y con su banco comunal pues le están permitiendo progresar.Venancio tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de  telas y materiales que le hacen falta, con la finalidad  de abastecerse y producir con mayor  tranquilidad; de esta manera espera seguir con la prosperidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Venancio, age 60, is married to Leoncia (age 45). They have five children. They live in their own house, which is located in the district of Quimbiri. He is a hardworking man and wants to offer a better quality of life to his family.

Venancio arrived from his home town with the goal of establishing a business in this area. He is engaged in the business of selling ornamental trim. He accomplishes this with tools with which he manufactures lace, pom-poms, and braid that are applied to slipcovers, drapes, and pennants, among other things.

He has the support of his wife and children in carrying out his work. His work generates a good income because there is not much competition. He is the only one engaged in the business in the area of Vrae. He also works with different municipalities when they make banners for the prizes in civic parades. His plan for the future is to open a new branch in the district of Pichari since he wants to increase his production and, at the same time, obtain better earnings.

This is his thirteenth loan with MFP, and he promises to continue to make all his payments, just as he has done previously. In addition, he is satisfied with the support he gets from the institution and his communal bank since they have permitted him to make progress. Venancio plans to invest the money applied for in the purchase of fabric and material that he lacks with the goal of supplying himself and producing with greater peace of mind. In this way he hopes that his business will continue to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase materials in order to supply his business.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer que atreves de los años ha logrado solidez en su trabajo de costura por más de  treces años, pues ha sido su medio de apoyar  a sus tres hijos.
También cuenta con el alquiler de un cuarto, el que ha venido mejorando para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Lo que ha logrado ha sido con el apoyo financiero de Afodenic, mediante préstamos en donde es su decimo ciclo y que todos han sido para mejora de vivienda y la inversión de su negocio.
Con esta nueva solicitud, repellara paredes de cuarto para dar mejor reforzamiento. Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, esponjas, entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who through more than thirteen years has been able to keep her sewing business going and in this way support her three children.

She also gets income from the rental of a room that she has been improving to better serve her tenants.

What has helped her has been the financing through Afodenic.  This is her tenth loan cycle and all have been used to improve the house and  to invest in her business.

Ana will use this new loan to plaster the walls of the room for reinforcement.  She will buy construction supplies such as: sand, cement, sponges, etc, to start the work.

loans.use: To buy contruction supplies such as sand, cement, and sponges to  plaster the walls of the room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for goods bought to sell in a grocery store

loans.name: Martin Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Martin tiene como actividad la confección de diferentes tipos de ropa según época, el realiza  el armado y la confección de las mismas para después comercializarla a terceros, el sr. Martin es una persona emprendedora, dinámica, joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida, esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial recta y una maquina over loock para renovar su maquinaria con la que trabaja y así mejorar e incrementar su producción, esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita crédito bajo este financiamiento ya que la primera vez le fue muy bien por lo cual agradece por esta oportunidad que le dieron.
texts.en: Mr. Martin's business is sewing different types of clothing, depending on the season. He puts the items together and sews them in order to later sell them to third parties. Mr. Martin is an enterprising, dynamic and young person with a great desire to succeed in life. He is now requesting a loan for the purchase of a straight industrial sewing machine and an Overlock machine in order to update his machines for his work. This will improve and increase his production. This is the second time that he has requested a loan with this organization, as the first time went very well. Thus, he is grateful for this opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: the purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a thirty years old husband and a father of one daughter and two sons, Fadi's wife has completed her high school education and didn't go to college because she got married and had children.  Now that Fadi's children are older and his wife can go back to school again she started at a university a couple of years ago.

Fadi came to FATEN and took a loan to pay for his wife tuition fees and books that she needs for school.  Fadi's wife wishes to finish school and start working as soon as possible.

Fadi who is a municipality employee appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: Pay for wife school tuition fees

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín es  cliente nuevo la actividad a la que se dedica es la de llantería, hace parchado de llantas venta de llantas usadas, el se dedica a esta actividad hace bastantes años, El vive en casa de su hijo mayor con su esposa el señor es bastante dinámico es por eso que en sus momentos libres se dedica a la fabrica de hojotas de caucho(que son las abarcas, sandalias que usan la gente del campo), el destino del créditos es precisamente para comprar material para esta segunda actividad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr Agustín is a new client. His business is a tire service shop. He repairs tires and sells used tires, and has had this business for many years. He lives with his wife in the home of his oldest child. This man is quite dynamic, and so in his free time he makes rubber hojotas (which are sandals worn by people in the countryside). This loan will be used to purchase material for this second business. He is a very hard-working and responsible person, and he is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of rubber for making sandals

loans.name: Lucinda Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Lucinda inicia su ciclo numero 15 con 16 socias, Nora es Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Nora y su esposo tienen un taller D. estructuras metálicas donD. fabrican: puertas, pasamanos, escaleras, ventanas, etc. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. fierros.
Nora ingresó a Finca por L. invitación D. su hermana, con éste es el tercer ciclo en el que participa, le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe, porque se habL. mucho D. matrimonio, familia, salud y negocio y pueD. ahorrar.
Su sueño es poder comprarse un terrero y construir su casa, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Lucinda community bank is starting its 15th loan cycle with 16 members.

Nora is the bank's president.  She is 48 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Nora and her husband have a metal workshop where they make doors, railings, stairs, windows, etc.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying iron.

Nora joined Finca at her sister's invitation.  This is the third loan cycle in which she has participated.  She likes the training that she receives because they talk a lot about marriage, family, health and business and she can also save.  Her dreams are to be able to buy a plot of land and build her own home, for her children to study and for them to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy iron

loans.name: Santos
