texts.es: Santos, de 51 años, vive en su casa que es  propia, junto a su esposo y dos de los cuatro hijos que tiene en total, pues los mayores son independientes.Esta emprendedora mujer  se dedica al comercio de  menús (comidas ofrecidas diariamente) para el comedor popular del estado, que funciona desde hace varios años en su casa. De esta manera se apoya, ya que a cambio de sus labores le proporcionan cinco platillos, con los cuales  subsiste su hogar  de lunes a viernes. Además se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio ya que dice que se entretiene mucho con  sus dos compañeras de cocina, y en esta labor lleva más de 15 años desarrollando esta  actividad que le gusta mucho. Paralelamente a esta labor  también realiza servicios de costura, confecciona polos y camisas con la ayuda de su hija. Ahora piensa coser buzos en grandes cantidades para el mes de marzo, pues desea cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.Es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como socia antigua esta comprometida en  pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además tiene planeado continuar apoyando en la directiva a su banco comunal.Santos  tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de cantidad de telas que necesita  para la confección de camisas y blusas, para las próximas labores académicas que empiezan en los  colegios, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir, y espera así  aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and two of her four children.  Her eldest two children live independently.

This enterprising woman sells meals every day in the popular state eatery which has been running for several years in her home.  In this way she supports herself since, in exchange for her work, they provide her with five meals with which she feeds her household from Monday to Friday.

Santos feels very satisfied with her business since she says that she has a lot of fun with her two cooking companions.  She has been in this work for more than 15 years and she really enjoys it.  In parallel with this work, she also offers sewing services, making polo shirts and shirts with the help of her daughter.  She is thinking of sewing tracksuits in large quantities for the month of March since she would like to fill an order that she has pending.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

This is Santos' tenth loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member, she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She also plans to continue supporting her community bank.  Santos plans to invest her loan money in buying a quantity of fabric that she needs to make shirts and blouses for the upcoming school year as she has several orders to fill and she thereby hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy fabric to continue with her business

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro, tiene 30 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la elaboración de juegos artificiales, pirotécnicos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos químicos para la preparación de juegos artificiales. Hermelinda, trabaja junto con su esposo, está en Finca desde hace varios años, le gusta porque se practican los valores, reciben charlas sobre la familia, matrimonio, manejo del ahorro y créditos.    
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para construir su casa y que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en: Herlinda is a member of the Futuro ["Future"] Community Bank. She is 30, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She makes fireworks. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of chemical supplies for making fireworks. Hermelinda works with her husband. She has been a member of Finca for several years, and she likes it because they promote values and have talks about families, marriage, and savings and credit management. Her dream is to be able to save up to build her house, and for her children to be able to study and be professionals.

loans.use: the purchase of chemical supplies

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Fututro, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Nancy se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gelatinas, frutas, chupetes ,salchipollos en la puerta de su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su negocio como pollo, papa, cremas, aceite, golosinas, entre otros. Nancy está en Finca desde hace 2 años, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal porque se practican los valores como la responsabilidad y puntualidad. Su sueño es que crezca su negocio y poder sacar profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Futuro communal bank.  She is 38 years old, married and has four children.

Nancy sells snacks, gelatin, fruit, popsicles and salchipollos (fried chicken with fried potatoes) at her front door.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise to stock her business like: chicken, potatoes, creams, oil and snacks, among others.

Nancy has been with Finca for the last two years.  She likes her communal bank meetings because they learn about values like responsibility and punctuality.

Her dream is that the business grows and to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy chicken, potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip, a mother of two daughters and two sons, while her husband Iyad was supporting the family being employed by a social program for a four year contract.  His contract was not renewed so Mariam and her husband decided to use the savings and open a small grocery store.

Mariam came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase a variety of goods to enrich the goods they sell and increase the income by increasing the number of clients they have. Mariam and Iyad are now able to cover all house expenses.

Mariam's husband Iyad appears in the picture here as Mariam is a conservative woman as are most of Gaza citizens.

loans.use: Purchase goods for the store and pay the electricity bill

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega 3 Group

texts.en:
Dionisia is the coordinator of her group Alfa y Omega (Alpha and Omega) 3, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago, the DR's second largest city, which is located in the Cibao valley and is famous for agricultural production. In this area, however, running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four of their seven children, while the other three children have their own home and family.

Dionisia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, selling a variety of cloths for Kids, Women and Men. She will use the profits to invest in her family and improving her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy meats, fruit, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Antonia es de la Comunidad de Chanquis, se dedica a la siembra de papa, quinua, a la elaboración de quesos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la en la compra de abonos, remedios, etc.  
La producción de la siembra lo vende en el Mercado Mayorista Nery García Zarate, los quesos que elabora los distribuye entre sus caseras.  
A Antonia le gusta Finca por las capacitaciones que recibe sobre los ahorros y créditos.
Su Sueño es poder comprar un terrero un construir su casa
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Futuro communal bank.  She is 40 years old, married and has six children.  Antonia is from the community of Chanquis. She’s a potato and quinoa farmer; she also makes cheeses.  She will use the requested loan to buy manure, remedies, etc.

She sells her crops at the Nery García Zarate Wholesale Market and the cheeses she makes among the local housewives.

Antonia likes Finca because of the training she receives about savings and loans.

Her dream is to buy a lot and build her house.

loans.use: To buy manure and remedies.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: La Sra. Máxima vive en la comunidad de junta pirai, del municipio de  el Torno, distante a unos 7 km del centro del pueblo, su actividad es la  crianza de cerdos los cría desde pequeños los alimenta y los vende por peso, también vende crías,  su esposo se dedica a extraer áridos del rio espejos, pertenecen a la asociación de ripieros de la junta pirai, , el destino del crédito es para la compra de alimentos balanceado, para cerdos, hace unos 30 años que se vino a vivir a la zona desde el departamento de Chuquisaca por motivos de trabajo, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Máxima lives in Junta Pirai community, in the municipality of El Torno, 7km from the center of town.  Her business activity is raising pigs.  She raises them from a young age, feeds them and then sells them by weight.  She also sells piglets.  Máxima's husband works extracting gravel and stone from the Espejos River.  He belongs to the "Gravel Extractors' Association of Junta Pirai".

Máxima will use her loan to buy balanced feed for her pigs.  She came to live in this area from Chuquisaca department 30 years ago, for work reasons.  She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Rene vive en el barrio villa norte del municipio del Torno, distante a 32 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es nacido en el departamento de Cochabamba, hace unos 20 años que se vino a vivir a la ciudad, es de ocupación mecánico eléctrico, hace unos tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, su esposa con la cual tiene tres hijos se dedica a labores del hogar, el destino el crédito es para comprar herramientas para su taller, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo y confianza que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Rene lives in the Villa Norte neighborhood in the town of Torno, 32 km from the city of Santa Cruz.  He was born in the state of Cochabamba and came to live in the city some 20 years ago.  He has worked as an electrical mechanic for 3 years.  He and his wife have 3 children and she takes care of their home.  The loan will be used to buy tools for his workshop.  He is thankful to the institution for the support and trust they have given him.

loans.use: Purchase Tools for his Workshop

loans.name: Nuevos Esfuerzos Group

texts.es: adfasd

loans.use: Compra de medicamentos

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, tiene 72 años, nació en la ciudad de San Pablo provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. 

Isabel se dedica a la venta de muebles de madera, ella lleva o envía sus productos a las ciudades de Arequipa, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado y otras. Ya son 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Isabel pertenece a la Asociación de vendedores de muebles “Costanera”  Cusco.  

Isabel espera recibir $ 1000 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo ropero, silla, camas, juegos de salas, etc. 

Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Isabel is 72 years old and was born in the city of San Pablo, which is in the province of Canchis and department of Cusco.  She currently lives with her two children in the city of Cusco.

Isabel sells wood furniture, which she brings or sends to Arequipa, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado, and other cities. She has been running this business for four years and it is going very well.  Isabel belongs to "Costanera," Cusco's association of furniture sellers.

Isabel is hoping to receive a loan of $1,000 USD.  She would use this money to buy merchandise like wardrobes, chairs, beds, and living room furniture.

Isabel belongs to the "Velasco Astete" Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank is in its ninth year of existence and is well-run by its board of directors.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like wardrobes, chairs, beds, and living room furniture

loans.name: Bettsy Lia

texts.es:
Bettsy, tiene 24 años, es casada pero todavía no tiene hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco departamento del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo en la misma ciudad. 

Bettsy es profesora de la institución educativa inicial “Jardín de Flores” pero en este momento se encuentra de vacaciones.  Ya son 3 años que trabaja en el jardín  y le va muy bien. Bettsy en sus horas libres se dedica a crear material educativo y a decorar salones para niños. 
 
Bettsy espera recibir $ 600 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cartulina, tela, colores, pintura, crayolas, etc. El sueño de Bettsy es trabajar como administradora en el ministerio de educación  sede Cusco. 

Bettsy pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Bettsy, 24, is married but doesn’t have children yet.  She was born in Cusco province, Cusco department and currently lives with her husband in that same city.

Bettsy is an Early Education Teacher at “Jardín de Flores” but is currently on vacation.  She has been working at the kindergarten for three years now and she does quite well.  In her free time, Bettsy makes teaching supplies and decorates classrooms.

Bettsy expects to receive a $600 USD loan that she’ll use to buy materials like construction paper, fabric, colors, paint, Crayolas, etc.  Bettsy’s dream is to work as an Administrator for the Cusco branch of the Ministry of Education.

Bettsy is a member of Asociacón Arariwa’s “Velasco Astete” communal bank which is in its ninth year of operation and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials like construction paper, fabric, paints, colors, Crayolas, etc.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El Sr. Adrián vive en el torno, es casado su actividad es la de transporte urbano, su esposa con la cual tiene un hijo, se dedica  a vender cosméticos y también desarrolla las  labores del hogar; el destino del crédito  es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, hace un año que se dedica a esta actividad, vive en la casa de sus padres, por lo que están ahorrando para tener su propia casa, se sienten agradecido con la institución por brindarle el apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Señor Adrián lives in El Torno and is married.  He has been working as a taxi driver for a year and his wife, with whom he has one son, sells cosmetics and takes care of the household chores.  He lives in his parent's house because he is saving to buy his own house. 

The loan will be used to maintain his vehicle.  He is grateful to the institution for the economic support that they are providing him.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco departamento del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo en la misma ciudad. 

Celia es profesora cesante pero todavía trabaja como profesora en la institución educativa privada “Leoncio Padro” y en este momento se encuentra D. vacaciones. Ya son 10 años que trabaja en el colegio y le va muy bien. Celia también tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, ella durante sus vacaciones abre desD. muy temprano y durante resto del año solo en las noches. 
 
Celia espera recibir $ 900 USD D. crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cerveza, arroz, gaseosas, agua mineral, etc. El sueño D. Celia ampliar su tienda o abrir otro tienda. 

Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” D. la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Celia, aged 59, is married and the mother of three children. She was born in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco, and currently lives with her husband in her native city.

Celia is a teacher who was laid off, but she still works as a teacher in the private school "Leoncio Padro". Currently she is on vacation. She has already worked for ten years in this school and is doing very well. Celia owns also a grocery store; during her vacations she opens it very early and during the rest of the year only in the evenings.

Celia expects to be granted a loan of US$900 which she will use to buy goods such as beer, rice, soft drinks, mineral water, etc.  Celia's dream is to expand her store or open another one.

Celia is a member of the communal bank "Velasco Astete" of the microfinance unit Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank is in its ninth year of operation and is well managed by its Board.

loans.use: To buy goods such as beer, rice, soft drinks, mineral water, etc.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la distrito de San Salvador provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Lucila se dedica la elaboración de artesanía de lana de alpaca, llama y oveja, ella elabora ponchos y mantas desde las 11 mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Ya son siete años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. 

Lucila espera recibir $ 600 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana. El sueño de Lucila es exportar sus productos a otros países. 

Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Lucila, 52, is married and has three children.  She was born in San Salvador district, Cusco province and currently lives with her husband in Cusco.

Lucila makes woolen crafts from alpaca, llama and sheep.  She makes ponchos and blankets from 11am until 5pm.  She’s been in this business for 7 years now and does quite well.

Lucila expects to receive a $600 USD loan that she’ll use to buy materials like wool, for example.  Her dream is to export her wares to other countries.

Lucila is a member of Asociacón Arariwa’s “Velasco Astete” communal bank which is in its ninth year of operation and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials like wool, for example.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, tiene 38 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la distrito de Anta provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo en la misma ciudad. 

Liliana se dedica a la elaboración de pan y alquila el horno de su vecino. Ya son dos años que trabaja en el horno y le va muy bien. 

Liliana espera recibir $ 600 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, levadura, azúcar, sal y otras más. El sueño de Liliana es comprar un terreno y construir su propio horno. 

Liliana pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Liliana, who is 38 years old, is married and has four children. She was born in the Anta Provincia district of Cusco, and she now lives with her husband in the same city.

Liliana bakes bread and rents her neighbor's oven. She has been working with the oven for two years, and things are going very well.

Liliana hopes to receive a loan of $600 USD, and she will use this money to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, salt, etc. Liliana's dream is to buy some land and build her own oven.

Liliana belongs to the Velasco Astete communal bank, of Kiva partner UMF Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank is in its first year of operation, and it is well administered by the board of directors.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients. For example: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma, tiene 68 años, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos de las  cuales todos son independientes, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con algunos de sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Irma trabajó en diferentes negocios como organizadora de eventos, costura, venta de lácteos y alquiler de cuartos. 

Irma espera recibir $ 1200 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para construir su casa para luego alquiler los dormitorios. El sueño es abrir un hospedaje en la casa colonial que compro hace poco. 

Irma pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Irma is 68 years old, widowed, and has four children who are all independent.  Irma was born in Cusco province and she currently lives in the city of Cusco with some of her children.

Irma has worked in a number of businesses, as an events organizer, sewing, selling dairy products and renting out rooms.

Irma hopes to receive a loan for $1,200 USD and she will use this money to build her home so that she can then rent out rooms.  Her dream is to open a business offering accommodations in the colonial-style house that she bought a short time ago.

Irma belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Velasco Astete" community bank.  This community bank is in its ninth year and is well run by a board of directors.

loans.use: To build her home

loans.name: Norma Mercedes

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 45 años, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con algunos de sus hijos en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Norma es profesora en la institución educativa “Primero de Enero” en el distrito de Santiago, ella por las horas libres se dedica a  dictar clases particulares y a elaborar material educativo para decorar salones. 
 
Norma espera recibir $ 1200 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales de librería como por ejemplo cartulina y telas. El sueño de Norma es abrir una academia en su domicilio.

Norma pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Norma, 45, is divorced and has three children.  She was born in Cusco province and currently lives in Cusco with some of her children.

Norma is a teacher at “Primero de Enero” School in Santiago district.  In her free time she gives private lessons and makes educational materials to use in decorating classrooms.

Norma expects to receive a $1200 USD loan that she’ll use to buy materials like construction paper and fabric.  Norma’s dream is to open an academy in her house.

Norma is a member of Asociacón Arariwa’s “Velasco Astete” communal bank which is in its ninth year of operation and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy bookstore supplies like construction paper and fabric.

loans.name: Los Exitosos Group

texts.es: Don  Mauricio V. C., es casado, tiene  cuatro  hijos, ha  cursado  el quinto grado de primaria,  siguen a su cargo, uno de sus hijos se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos tales como ganado porcino y Vacuno,  tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunos vecinos y una vecina   organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Los Exitosos, El grupo cuenta con cinco  integrantes:  quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar,: la crianza de animales, Servicio  tienda de consumo diario y reparación de calzados. El préstamo el lo utilizará para compra de animales domésticos para sus crianza  y su venta   y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser el dueño del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en ASDIR.
texts.en:
Mr. Mauricio V. C. is married and has four children.  He finished fifth grade.  His children are still in his care.  One of his sons raises domestic animals like cattle and pigs; he’s had this business for 15 years now.  With much enthusiasm and support from several neighbors they got together to form a group to request a loan.  The group is called “Los Exitosos” (The Successful Ones).

It has five members who are involved in a variety of activities among which we can mention the following: raising animals, grocery store, shoe repairs.

The loan will be used to buy domestic animals to raise for subsequent sale thus increasing sales volume.  One of the difficulties of being a business owner is the lack of capital but, with help from his children, he has managed to get ahead and he hopes his business will be larger and more productive with help from the loan he’s asking from ASDIR.

loans.use: To buy domestic animals.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Aquila, tiene el cargo D. secretaria en el grupo” SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS” ella es una D. las 11 socias, Aquilina  tiene 64 y su edad no es ningún impedimento para seguir trabajando  ella  siempre salio adelante por sus hijos quienes ahora son mayores D. edad, a pesar que recibe la ayuda D. ellos no quiere  dejar su negocio una bodega muy bien constituida ya tiene el negocio 8 años, se llama bodega “JUANITO”, este trabajo ha sido D. mucha ayuda para ella  por que la ayuda  a solventar sus propios gastos  y no depender D. nadie eso la hace sentir útil y autosuficiente, en su bodega tiene toda clase D. productos desD. abarrotes como azucar,arroz,fideos, toda clase D. bebidas y embutidos. Siempre trata D. que su tienda se mantenga surtida, sus prestamos son D. mucha ayuda  con el dinero recibido comprara  bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos etc. es lo que mas se venD. por la época D. verano, lo que mas quiere en la vida es seguir con su negocio y lograr que crezca un poco mas. 

* La Sra. Aquila  es la tercera D. las paradas viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
Aquila is the Secretary of the “SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS” (Lord of Miracles) group.  It has 11 members.  Aquila is 64 years old but her age is no impediment to continue working.  She always got ahead for her children who are all now adults.  Despite receiving some help from them she doesn’t want to leave her grocery store which is now well established; it’s been in operation 8 years.  It’s called “JUANITO.”

This business has been of great help to her because it helps her meet her personal expenses and not be dependent on anyone; this makes her feel useful and self-sufficient.  

She has all kinds of products stocked in her grocery store like: sugar, rice, pasta, all kinds of beverages and cured meats.  She always strives to keep it well stocked.  The loans are of great use to her because she uses the money to buy beverages like soft drinks, juices, etc. which is what sells the most during the summer season.  What she most wants in life is to stay in business and that the business grows a bit more.

*Aquila is standing, third from the left, wearing a red polo shirt.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Racana Group

texts.es: Doña Agustina García González, es una  señora soltera, es  analfabeta,  ella se dedica a la venta  D. leña,    tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda D. algunas vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Rácana , El grupo cuenta con seis  integrantes: quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: la crianza D. animales, Cultivo D.  tomates, venta D. frutas, verduras, y venta D. leña.    El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. mercadería  y  así ampliar su capital y así también incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Una D. las dificultades D. ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda D. sus hijos y espera que su negocio sea más granD. y productivo. Con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en ASDIR.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agustina García González is single and illiterate.  She sells firewood.  She’s had this business for 10 years.  With the enthusiasm and help of several neighbors they organized a group to solicit funds.  The group is called “Rácana.” It has six members who are involved in a variety of activities among which we can mention the following: raising animals, growing tomatoes, fruit, vegetable and firewood sales.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise and increase her capital as well as volume of sales.  One of the difficulties with being the business owner is the lack of capital but, with help from her children, she’s managed to get ahead and she hopes the business will be still larger and more productive with the help from the loan requested from ASDIR.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 31 one old man from Jabalia refugee camp, he is married and has no children. Ibrahim is an accountant, Ibrahim and his wife wanted to paint the walls in their house.

Ibrahim came to FATEN and took a $700 loan to pay for painting expenses. Ibrahim helps his parents with a small part of his salary as well.

Ibrahim appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay for house painting expenses

loans.name: Tikariy Quillahuata Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Tikariy Quillahuata” ya tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por 11 mujeres y 3 varones, los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Quillahuata que está ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios viven en esta comunidad y se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.   
 
Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de comestibles, crianza de animales menores, venta de flores, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, crianza y venta de cuyes. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de construcción de casas y asistencia social.  
 
Felicita, tiene 32 años y nació en el distrito de Colquepata provincia del Paucartambo departamento del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Felicita vive junto con su esposo y sus cinco hijos en la comunidad de Quillahuata. Su actividad económica principal de Felicita es la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y muchas animales más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Felicita desea invertir en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
The "Tikariy Quillahuata" Community Bank has been around for four years and is made up of eleven women and three men. The members are hard-working and enterprising people who are constantly looking for opportunities to get ahead and offer their children a better life through their daily hard work. The community bank meets every thirty days in the Quillahuata community, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. The majority of the members live in this community and work in livestock and agriculture.

The following are examples of the businesses of some of the members: food sales; raising small animals; flower sales; vegetable sales; crafts sales; and raising and selling guinea pigs. Other members offer home construction services and social assistance.
 
Felicita, age 32, was born in the Colquepata district, in the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco, Peru. Felicita currently lives with her husband and their five children in the Quillahuata community. Felicita's main business is raising, buying and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, and many others. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. Felicita wants to invest in the business' capital and wants to purchase more small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Noemi Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora Noemí C. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en el cantón Paute, este cantón es reconocido por su clima templado y la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura siendo su mayor producción la floricultura, también se dedican a la cría de animales.

La Señora Noemí tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo pasa en casa, tienen casa propia la misma que aun están pagando.
 
Doña Noemí se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos, esta actividad la realiza hace 32 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su décimo crédito que realiza en la fundación y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más verduras. Su sueño es terminar de pagar todas sus deudas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemí C. is a member of the Caritas Alegres (Cheerful Little Faces) communal bank.  She lives in Paute canton which is renowned for its mild climate and beautiful scenery.  Its residents are for the most part farmers the main crops being flowers; they also raise animals.

Noemí is 56 years old, married and has 6 children who are adults, married and independent.  Her husband stays home and they have their own house which they are still paying off.

Noemí sells vegetables and grains.  She has been in this line of work for 32 years.  She has a stand of her own in one of the city’s markets.  She works Sunday to Sunday.

This is the 10th loan she’s negotiated with the Fundación and she intends to use the money from the loan to buy more vegetables.  Her dream is to finish paying off all her debts.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Julia Narcisa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia C. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca que es reconocida por la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes deportistas, artistas y poetas.
 
La Señora Julia tiene 51 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 27 y dos hijos gemelos de 26 años, todos sus hijos estudian en la Universidad y también trabajan. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Doña Julia es chofer profesional y se dedica al transporte escolar, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, trabaja todo el día ya que transporta a niños de escuela y jóvenes de colegio.
 
Se encuentra dos años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar repuestos para su vehiculo. Su sueño es  seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia C. is a member of the Caritas Alegres (Cheerful Little Faces) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is renowned for the colonial beauty of its historic city center.  This city is the birthplace of great athletes, artists and poets.

Julia is 51 years old, divorced and has 3 children, one who is 27 and twins who are 26.  All of her children are in the university and also work.  She does not own a house of her own; she lives in her parents’ house.

Julia is a professional school bus driver.  She’s been in this line of work for 15 years.  She works all day because she transports children to school and teenagers to high school

She has been in the communal bank for two years and she likes it because she has good friends there.  She will use the money from her loan to buy vehicle replacement parts.  Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: María Transito

texts.es:
La Señora. María P. es socia del banco comunal Caritas Alegres, vive en la comunidad de Tutupali Chico que se encuentra en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por la belleza natural, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura.

La Señora. María tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 10 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros son de 18, 17, 14 gemelas, 12, 10 y 7 años de edad, su cuarto y quinto hijo trabajan para sus gastos, sus hijas gemelas y su hija de 12 años pasan en la casa, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo ha sufrido un accidente en el trabajo por lo que por el momento se encuentra en casa, tiene una casita que es pequeña de adobe.

Doña María se dedica al negocio de granos, frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, tiene un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en el negocio. Su meta es  tener animales para la cría y también arreglar su casa.
texts.en: Señora María P. is a member of the communal bank, Caritas Alegres ("Happy Faces").  She lives in the Tutupali Chico community, which is located outside of the city of Cuenca.  This area is characterized for its natural beauty and the people there work in agriculture.  Señora María is 48 years old, married, and has 10 children.  3 of them are married and independent.  Her other single children are ages 18, 17, 14 year-old twins, 12, 10, and 7.  Her fourth and fifth child work to contribute towards their household costs.  Her twin girls and her 12 year-old daughter spend time at home.  Her two youngest children study at a school in the city.  Her husband suffered an accident at his work which means that he is currently at home., in their tiny adobe house.  Señora María works in the grains, fruit, and vegetable business.  She has been working in this sector for the past 15 years.  She has her own stall at a market in the city and works every day of the week.  This is her third credit with the communal bank and enjoys it because she has made many good friends.  She plans to invest the money from this credit in her business.  Her goal is to own and raise livestock and also to fix her house.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, and grains.

loans.name: Tambopata De Tipon Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “TAMBOPATA DE TIPON”; el banco  comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Tipon,  provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes; La socia tiene 31 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica  a administrar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes y a prestar el servicio de llamadas telefónicas a diferentes destinos dentro del país a celulares y teléfonos fijos locales. La socia realiza llamadas a celulares de preferencia, ella recarga sus equipos celulares con diferentes montos y los alquila a 0.50 céntimos el minuto, la socia trabaja  desde el año 2000 haciendo en la tienda de abarrotes y haciendo llamadas a celulares desde hace dos años. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y para recargar sus dos teléfonos celulares.

En la foto encontramos al Sr. Pio y a la Sra. Lourdes en sus respectivos negocios, ellos se fueron temprano de la reunion motivo por el cual los busque en sus negocios para tomarles la foto uno por uno a diferentes horas, los socios tenian permiso para retirarse temprano y dejar al grupo para que termine la reunion, la socia Lourdes tiene un problema optalmologico y está un poco avergonzada de ver a la cámara.

Los otros socios se dedican a la prestar servicio de taxis, a la agricultura y ganadería, a la compra y venta de animales menores en especial cuyes para la venta, a la tienda abarrotes.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 31, is a member of the “TAMBOPATA DE TIPON” communal bank which is located in Tipon district, Cusco province and department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She runs a small grocery store and provides telephone services to various destinations in the country for cell phones and local fixed line phones.  She prefers cell phone calls.  She recharges her cell phones with various amounts and leases them out for 0.50 céntimos a minute.  She has been running the grocery store since 2000 and making cell phone calls for the last two years.

She is asking for a loan to stock the grocery store and to recharge her two cell phones.

In the photo, Lourdes and Pio are shown at their respective businesses. Because they left the group meeting early, they had their photos taken separately at their businesses later on. They had permission to leave the group early, before the meeting had ended. Lourdes has an ophthalmological problem, so she was a little embarrassed to look at the camera. 

The other group members are taxi drivers, farmers and cattlemen; some raise small farm animals, especially guinea pigs, to sell and some are grocers.

She values the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To stock her grocery store and to recharge her two cell phones.

loans.name: Morlaquitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Morlaquitas esta conformado por 11 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes trabajan día a día en sus diferentes trabajos para crecer en la economía de sus hogares, son M. alegres, amables y siempre ven la vida con optimismo. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, por su cultura y tradiciones, la gastronomía que es M. variada y cautiva a propios y extraños.

La Señora. María V. es socia del banco comunal Morlaquitas, vive por la parroquia de Sayausi, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga a este grupo de mujeres trabajadoras.
Nuestra socia tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene un hijo que tiene 15 años de edad y esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doña María hace 15 años se dedica a la venta ambulante de frutas, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos, los que vende en su propia comunidad
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y pollos. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.

La Señora. Martha S. es socia del banco comunal Morlaquitas, vive por el sector de la Gloria, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 5, 4 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad y también trabaja para solventar sus gastos, su segunda hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad y sus dos hijas ultimas se encuentran en una maternal. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus interprovincial, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
La Señora Martha es oriunda de Chile y ha llegado hace 10 años a nuestra ciudad por estudios,  le gusto esta ciudad por lo que se ha quedado a vivir. Hace 5 meses se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal y Esika, y hace 3 años también se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos. 
Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y también unas botas para incursionar en este nuevo negocio. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para poder vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
There are eleven women and one man in the Morlaquitas Community Bank. They all work on a daily basis at their different jobs to earn enough money to support their families. They are cheerful and friendly, and approach life optimistically. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca which is known for the architectural beauty of its city centre, its culture and traditions, and its wide variety of food beloved by local people as well as foreigners.

Señora María V. is a member of the Morlaquitas Bank. She lives in Sayausi parish and is currently in her second loan cycle. She was invited to join this group of hardworking women by a friend. María is 40 years old, married, and has a 15-year old son who attends high school. Her husband works in construction. By working hard together they have managed to build their own house.

Fifteen years ago María started selling fruit in the streets of Cuenca. She works seven days a week from 9am to 6pm. At home she also raises guinea pigs and chickens which she sells in the neighbourhood. The money from the loan will be used to buy fruit and chickens. Her goal is to expand her business.

Señora Martha S. is also a member of the Morlaquitas Bank. She lives in the neighbourhood of La Gloria. She is 38 years old and has four children aged 22, 5, 4, and 1. Her oldest son is a university student and also has a job to pay his expenses. Her next oldest is a daughter who is a student at a local school, and her other two daughters go to a nursery. Martha’s husband is a driver of an interprovincial bus. By working hard together they have managed to build their own home.

Martha is a native of Chile and came to this city to attend school. She liked the city so stayed on to live here. For the past five months she has been selling Yanbal and Esika cosmetics; she has also raised and sold chickens for three years.

This is Martha’s first loan with the Bank. She was invited to join by a friend. She plans to use the money to buy cosmetics and a pair of boots to wear to work in her new business. Her goal is to buy a vehicle to use when she is out selling her products.

loans.use: to buy fruit, chickens, cosmetics and boots

loans.name: Luz De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Islen, 30, is a borrower who lives in La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz de Bendicion (Light of Blessing) 1 & 2, and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Islen is a mother of two children, she runs a little food store and clothings sales from her home in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. Those living in the Dominican Republic have no access to running potable water, and electricity and healthcare are unreliable at best. Despite these difficulties, Islen is taking out this loan, her third with Esperanza International, in hopes of continue improving her life and the lives of her family, also compound with her long term partner.

Specifically, Islen will be using this loan to purchase a variety of clothes, for kids, and women especially; and to buy goods for her small food stall. She hopes to make something of herself through her work while giving “a future to her children so they can become useful to society”. Mabel has high hopes for her businesses, and with this program, because she will be able to improve her kind of living. Thank you for lending to Islen and the Luz de Bendicion group!

loans.use: to buy clothing and goods for sale

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito esta formado por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes son amigos, trabajan en diferentes actividades y cada quince días se reúnen saliendo así de su rutina diaria, son amables y cordiales, luchan cada día para mejorar su economía. Viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad cuna de grandes deportistas, poetas, la ciudad encierra la naturaleza, la arquitectura de lo colonial y lo moderno.

La Señorita. Susana Y. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito, vive por la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su segundo crédito y ha sido invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres exitosas.
Nuestra socia es muy joven tiene 18 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres, su papá es de profesión chofer y sus mamá es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señorita Susana se encuentra cursando el último año de los estudios del colegio y hace un año se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los que vende a sus compañeras en el colegio.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para continuar con su negocio. Su meta seguir una carrera universitaria.

La Señora. Mónica A. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Éxito, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 19 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo que tiene 8 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como carpintero y viven en una casa que es de su propiedad.
Doña Mónica se dedica a trabajar como costurera, esta actividad la realiza hace un año, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este hermoso grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para iniciar en esta labor. Su sueño es  cursar los estudios universitarios y seguir la carrera de diseño grafico.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Mujeres de Éxito ("Successful Women"), is composed of 8 women and 2 male guest members.  They all work in different sectors, but every fifteen days they get together to break away from their daily routine.  They are friendly and cordial, and fight every day to improve their economic situation.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which is the birthplace of great athletes and poets.  It is a city surrounded by natural beauty and colonial and modern architecture.

Señorita Susana Y. is a member of this communal bank.  She lives in the Valle neighborhood.  This is her second credit and she was invited by her mother to become a part of this wonderful group of successful women.  She is a young woman of 18 years old.  She is single and lives at her parent's house.  Her father is a chauffeur and her mother is a business woman.  They do not own their home, but rent it.  She is currently finishing her last year of high school and has been selling cosmetics to her classmates for the past year.  She plans to invest her credit in the purchase of cosmetics in order to continue her business.  Her goal is to pursue a college degree.

Señora Mónica A. is another member of this communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca and is 19 years old.  She has an 8 month old son.  Her husband works as a carpenter and they live in a home that they own.  For over a year, she has worked as a seamstress.  She works Monday through Saturday from 7am to 6pm.  This is her first credit with the communal bank and was invited by her mother-in-law to become a part of this beautiful group.  She plans to invest the money from this credit in the purchase of clothing.  Her dream is to finish her university studies and major in graphic design.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch P. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in his parents' fence. Banzragch operates a meat trading business in his town. He moved to his current town in 2000 and started his meat trading business in 2005 after operating a mobile food products trading business between 2000 and 2004. After years of operation, he has built a stable operation. For the future, he hopes to continue operating his business with stable operation. Banzragch is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat to sell as a retailer

loans.name: Juana Florentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clara Froilana J. G. vive junto a su esposo e hijo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en casablanca. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de campo.
La Sra. Clara requiere el crédito para realizar algunos arreglos a su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es terminar de construir su vivienda y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Señora Clara Froilana J. G. lives with her husband and son.  They own their home, which is located in Casablanca.  She works in the sale of groceries and her husband works as a farmhand.  She needs a credit in order to be able to fix her house.  Her dream, according to what she told us, is to finish constructing her home and as such be able to give her family a better quality of life.  She is very grateful for the support that we are offering her through this financing.

loans.use: Improve living quarters.

loans.name: Bundan

texts.en:
Bundan M. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Har-Horin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son attends a local kindergarten and his wife works for the local museum.

Bundan has been operating a public transport service between Har-horin and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, since 2001. After many years of owning this business, he has built a stable operation and has gained not only much experience but also a positive reputation among his customers. With his business profits, he was able to build a house in his enclosure where the family currently lives. For the future, Bundan plans to start saving money for his children's future. He is a very business-minded and clever man and is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase parts and tools for his mini-bus.

loans.use: to purchase parts and tools for his mini-bus

loans.name: Las Diez Azucenas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Las Diez Azucenas, el nombre se debe a que en la casa de reunión se encuentran estas flores. En la ciudad de Tehuacan en el estado de Puebla en Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La sra. Guadalupe G. A.se dedica a la venta de leche,negocio que inicio hace dos años. Solicita el  prestamo para la compra de pastura para su ganado ya que con una buena alimentacion del ganado tienen una mejor productividad para asi poder tener mas ventas. Tiene 57 años, estudio hasta el 6 año de primaria. Es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos 2 varon y 2 mujeres. Sus clientes opinan que tiene buen servicio porque siempre llega puntual y su producto no está alterado, ademas cuenta con lo necesario para cumplir con todos sus clientes. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente alegre porque va a poder asegurar la alimentación de su ganado. Para asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.Tambien espera que su negocio tenga crecimiento y seguir apoyando a el menor de sus hijos para que salga adelante ya que aun esta estudiando y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en: This group is called Las Diez Azucenas ("The Ten White Lillies"), which originates from the presence of these flowers in the house where they hold their meetings.  Señora Guadalupe G.A. works in the sale of milk, a business that she began over two years ago.  She is seeking a loan in order to be able to purchase pastures for her livestock, since feeding her livestock better will produce better milk and higher sales.  She is 57 years old and her highest level of education is the 6th grade.  She is married and has 4 children: 2 boys and 2 girls.  Her customers say that she offers great service because she always arrives on time and her products are never altered.  In addition, she has enough to fulfill the demands of her customers.  As she seeks this loan, she feels happy because she is able to ensure the feeding of her livestock and thus continue satisfying her customers.  She also hopes to grow her business and continue supporting her children so that they may continue studying and have a successful future.

loans.use: Purchase pasture for livestock.

loans.name: Otgonmunh

texts.en:
Otgonmunh is 32 years old and lives with her husband, two children and her orphan sibling in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in her sibling's enclosure. Her oldest son attends a local secondary school and her husband operates a dairy products sales business.

Otgonmunh operates a clothes making business out of a rented space in her town, sewing a variety of clothing items according to her customers' orders. She started her own business in 2005 after living and working as a herder in the countryside with her family. For the future, she plans to expand her rented space and establish her own tailoring factory. Otgonmunh is requesting a 440,000 MNT loan in order to purchase an electric sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: La Capilla Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama L. CapilL., por el lugar donD. se reune el grupo que es al lado D. una capilL., ubicada en Atlacomulco Estado D. Mexico. Este grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. Eulalia O. es integrante D. este grupo.Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta 6to D. primaria. Es viuda pero ha sido muy trabajadora y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios, tiene 3 hijos: 1 hombre y 2 mujeres. ElL. se dedica día a día hacer crecer su negocio D. artículos D. fantasía, tiene 2 años que inició su negocio con 5 años D. experiencia, como el negocio es ambulante con mucha creatividad e inovación ha invertido en él. Solicita el prestamo para incrementar sus productos  y asi satisfacer L. demanda D. los clientes y mejorar su estabilidad económica. También desea en un futuro invertir en maquinaria para producir paletería y nevería ya que es un producto demandante por el mercado. Al momento D. solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz porque tendrá L. oportunidad D. mejorar su negocio y cumplir con sus objetivos en un plazo no muy largo y con esto espera brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en: This group is called, L. CapilL. ("Chapel"), which originates from the fact that this group meets next to a chapel located in Atlacomulco Estado D. Mexico.  This group is composed of 9 members.  Eulalia O. is one member of this group. She is 47 years old.  Her highest level of education is the 6th graD..  She is a widow, but with her hard work has been able to support her children and their studies.  She has 3 children: 1 boy and 2 girls.  She works daily to grow her costume jewelry business.  She began her business 2 years ago with over 5 years of experience.  Since her business is mobile, she has creatively invested in refreshments and sweets, which has helped her support her family.  She is seeking a loan in order to be able to increase her merchandise and as such satisfy her customers' demands and improve her economic stability.  In the future, she hopes to invest in machinery to help produce ice-cream bars and refrigerate them since they are popular items.  At the moment, she feels happy because she has the opportunity to improve her business and fulfill her objectives in the near future.  With this, she hopes to be able to offer her family a stable financial situation.

loans.use: artículos de fantasía.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen R., age 31, is a married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Sen R.’s husband earns a living by climbing the palm trees in the village. Palm tree climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in communes. Sen R. has a plot of farming land on which she harvests her rice crop. She had hired a few domestic laborers to harvest her crop but she lacks some money to pay the rice harvest fee. Therefore, Sen R. is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the rice harvest fee

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 44 years old and lives with her husband, two children and son-in-law in a house and enclosure in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children and her son-in-law all attend university and her husband operates a welding service business to supplement his family's income.

Tungalag has been operating a construction materials sales business at the Margad construction market since 2004 and has gained a lot of experience in her trade. After many years of running this business, her working capital has increased to a level of 6,000,000 MNT and her sales income exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. Tungalag's daughter is pregnant; therefore, she is planning to buy a car for her family in the near future. She plans to start operating another business, a bath house service, and has completed building her workplace. Tungalag is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan in order to purchase 4 new hot water boilers for her future bath house.

loans.use: to purchase 4 new hot water boilers for her future bath house

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Tom, Kim C. is a 52-year-old who makes her daily income by growing rice on her farm land. She inherited the land from her grandmother four years ago. She and her husband are working together in the farming business, and they usually get good results from their rice crop, in both rainy and dry seasons. For the last two months, Kim C. has been doing dry season rice cultivation but her crop is not growing well because of a lack of fertilizer. To deal with this problem, Kim C. would like to request a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer for her rice fields, and to pay for plowing costs. The couple has four children; one of them is single and three of them are married.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for her crop, and to pay for plowing costs.

loans.name: Shous' Group

texts.en:
Four people are forming this group loan. Mrs. Shous S., a 29-year-old married woman, was selected group leader by its members. The members of this group loan live in Ta Khmau village in Kandal province. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Shous S. is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Yorn Sok, is a construction foreman.  Mrs. Shous S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies for her husband to use in his work.  With their careers, they are able to earn a small income to support their two children: one is attending a local school, and the younger one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for her husband

loans.name: Davaamunh

texts.en:
Davaamunh is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in his parents' enclosure. His wife works as a salesperson in the Merkuri market in the city.

Davaamunh started his business in 2007 with the help of his friend. He makes a variety of wooden items and furniture according to his customers' orders to support his family. Since 2010, he has operated this business on his own. After years of hard work, he was able to build a workplace in his enclosure. For the future, he plans to decorate his own workplace. Davaamunh is a modest man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to make repairs and decoration in his workplace.

loans.use: to make repairs and decoration in his workplace

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita, 55 years old, is married and supports her family by operating a tailoring business. She lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her tailoring business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Clarita now earns an average monthly income of PHP 25,000.

Clarita is borrowing PHP 23,000 in order to purchase tailoring materials. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Clarita hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman who lives in Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing. Her husband, Ronaldo C., who is 37 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 12 and 15 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business.

Alma joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Alma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth loan she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing nets and equipment so that she can continue to save up for a future house renovation.

Alma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and equipment.

loans.name: Soem's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Preaek Kong Reach village in Kandal province. This group loan selected Mrs. Soem K., who was born in 1972, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve the family standard of living.
 
Mrs. Soem K. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land which she uses to cultivate rice to make a living. With this farming, she needs a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice. In addition to farming, she also breeds pigs at home. Her husband, Mr. Sam Koy, 37 years-old, works as a construction worker where he receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline for cultivating rice.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Kandal Kaoh village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seang V. was selected as leader by the other members. Each member will use her portion of the loan for a different purpose to improve her family's living standards.

Mrs. Seang V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows leeks. She doesn’t have enough money to support her farming, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate the leeks. Her husband, Mr. Thuon Thet, 33 years old, works as an iron welder in a company, earning a small salary to support the family. This couple has three children; one attends a local school and the others, 5 and 3 years old, are not yet in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cultivating leeks

loans.name: Tegshee

texts.en:
Tegshee is 31-years-old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. All of her three children attend a local school. Her husband works for the gold mine during summer months and helps Tegshee with the business during summer months.

Tegshee operates a clothing sales business at a local market in the city. Currently her business is good, and she has two stalls at which she sells her goods, which are imported from China. She started her business in 2005 after operating a grocery trading business between 2002 and 2004. She works hard to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in order to buy her own apartment for her family. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods to sell for upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian new year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing goods to sell

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng L., 55, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on his own land for many years. He is married to Khoum, 56, who assists him in the business. They have given birth to five children; two children are single and the other three are married. 

One son works repairing cars in the market in Phnom Penh City. He can earn a profit of about $6.66 per day, and he is the core revenue-making person in the famiL.. RecentL., he has lacked some money needed to buy additional materials required for providing his services. To encourage his son, Seng L. is seeking a loan from Kiva for his son to purchase some equipment necessary for fixing cars.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment necessary for fixing cars.

loans.name: Meng's Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Svay village, in the province of Kandal, there are seventeen members making a village bank loan. Mr. Meng S. is 45 years old, and he is the village bank president selected by its members. Each of them will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family's living standards.

Mr. Meng S. and his wife, Mrs. Chheng Siebly, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate rice for a living. For their farm, Mr. Meng S. would like to ask for a loan to buy farming supplies for cultivating rice. He wants to use the rest of the loan to support his fishing. Aside from farming, they also earn their living through fishing. 

This couple works hard with their carriers to support their six children, two of whom are fisherman while the others are students who help their parents with their businesses.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for cultivating rice

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa is a recent widow who lives with her five children, ages 1 to 24, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and five of her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her older daughter, Shurenchimeg, works as a servant with a monthly salary of 140,000 MNT for the local university and her younger son, Amarjargal, attends a primary school. Tsevelmaa with her daughter helps operates a meat trading business and her  daughter Uranchimeg sometimes setting in her stall and selling meat in local market. Also Tsevelmaa works as a welder, which is a before was work her husband. She provides a variety of welding service and earns monthly revenue of 80,000 MNT. She started her own business in 2006 by selling a variety of meat. Her husband, who passed away in 2008, had been working as a welder for his entire life. In the future, she plans to continue operating her meat selling business with a stable operation for several years and afford to build a house in her fence. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 38 years old, married and supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Bogo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Herminia is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Herminia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar is 27 years old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He operates a clothing retail trading business out of a stall in the largest outdoor market, Narantuul, in the city. He started his business in 2010 with working capital of 900,000 MNT, which has increased to a 1,000,000 MNT within a short period. His business is located in a popular spot of the market where he attracts many customers. He wants to expand his business in the future. He is requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase more varieties of shirts for his clothing sales business.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts

loans.name: Tsetsegbayar

texts.en: Tsetsegbayar is 41 years old and lives with her fiance and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house and fence. Her daughters both attend university and Tsetsegbayar operates a used clothing retail business in the Narantuul market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar, with the help of her fiance. She began her business in 2000 and has gained much experience over the years.  Tsetsegbayar is an honest person and says, "I plan to approve our marriage very soon." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her product line of children's clothes for her second hand clothes trading business.

loans.use: To increase her product line

loans.name: Tsogbadrah

texts.en: Tsogbadrah is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Tsogbadrah operates a consumer goods selling business at a local market in his town with the help of his wife. He started this business in 2009 with working capital of 2,000,000 MNT after working for the local repair center. He sells a variety of consumer goods and clothes that are imported from China. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and establish his own car repair center. Tsogbadrah is a modest man and says, "I want to start operating another business, a car repair center, in addition to my current business." He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more products to sell for the upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian new year.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Ol

texts.en: Selling used motor bike is the main activity of Mr. Ol P.. He also buys used motorbikes at reasonable price from people in the village and then sells them to gain a profit. He started this selling business in early 1999 and he earns about $2.50 per day. This income mainly serves to meet his family’s daily expenses. His wife manages the household work and sells a few goods such as fast food, soft drinks, and other products. She earns an income of approximately $2 per day. They have two children; all of them are single and they are student in the local school. Presently, Mr. Ol P. wants to expand his selling business by purchasing more used good motor bikes for sales. This is the reason that Mr. Ol P. would like a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more used motor bikes for sales.

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en:
In Kampong Svay village, Kandal province, there are 13 members of a village bank loan. Mr. Sat L. is 52 years old and the village bank president. He was selected by the group members. The members of this village bank loan hope to increase their income to improve the family living conditions with these loans. 

Mr. Sat L. and his wife, Mrs. Chheng Leang Eng, are fishermen in the local village. They earn a little income to support their family. Currently, their business does not have enough fishing supplies for fishing. So in order to support this business, Mr. Sat L. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies for fishing.

This spouse is working hard to support his six children. Three of the children attend a local school and the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Donna May

texts.en:
Donna May is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business selling cosmetics. Her husband Joel D. J., who is 40 years old, works as a government employee to earn his living. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Donna May joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Donna May has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for her cosmetics business to continue to save up for the future education of her children. Donna May is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
